[Ground Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GroundPunch): Rude can do these to launch a [Ground Wave](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GroundWave) or three at the party as well as summon energy geysers from under them.

[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): With Reno. They're often seen around each other, and Rude fights Cloud the first time to avenge Reno, who Cloud had defeated earlier.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths):
    - His first encounter with Cloud has him feeding some doves, before he challenges Cloud to a fight. - He's part of a private bar in Junon for bald patrons, who sing and dance together.

[Ironic Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronicName): His codename is "Rude", yet compared to the cocky and foulmouthed Reno, or the cold and elitist Tseng, Rude is practically a nice guy, no matter how hard he tries to look otherwise.

[Just Following Orders](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustFollowingOrders): His reasoning for  (SPOILER) dropping the Sector 7 plate, telling Reno that "orders are orders" when he protests , even when Aerith tried to talk Cloud out of fighting Rude and claims that's he a bad person, Rude agree with her point, but said that his job requires him to do "bad things sometimes". He later shares Reno's regrets and becomes angry alongside his partner with Tseng's attempts to morally justify the action.

[Mighty Glacier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MightyGlacier): Rude hits hard and is very durable, and if you try to attack without paying attention, he can counter or [No-Sell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSell) attacks. At the same time, he isn't very fast, meaning once he gets into an attack position, he generally remains there for a time, leaving him wide open for ranged attacks. This is emphasized in the [Dual Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualBoss) fight with him and Reno; while both will move around the battlefield, Reno practically is teleporting around which makes him easier to stagger, while Rude will prefer to stick in one place for a bit.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag):
    - Like Reno, his appearance is lifted from *Advent Children*, but with a slightly different goatee, sideburns, and an all-black suit. - When his sunglasses are destroyed in his first fight with Cloud, he pulls out another pair to replace them - just like in *Advent Children*. This becomes something of a running gag, as whenever his sunglasses break or even just fall off, he simply pulls out another pair. - Though not yet explicitly stated, Rude's [crush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessSuitor) on Tifa seems to have remained intact. The Sector 7's pillar fight being a [Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut) to the Turks boss battles in the original where Rude targets the other members if Tifa was in the party and if she was the last one left, he'd either skip his turn or use his basic attack instead. Now, in *Remake*, he'll try to specifically focus on Cloud and Barret and do his best to only guard against Tifa.

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): When Elena get's stuck combing the Corel Desert in search for  (SPOILER)  Dyne , she calls up Rude and demands that he hurry up, find everyone, and bring her ice cream. While Rude does hang up on her, in the next scene Elena is in the helicopter with him enjoying a popsicle.

[Punch-Clock Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunchClockVillain): He hounds Aerith and opposes Cloud because it's his job to do so, and Aerith asks Cloud not to pick a fight with him for this reason. Rude himself notes that he's not a bad person, even if he sometimes has to do bad things.
[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): The blue to Reno's red.

[Stronger Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongerThanTheyLook): Rude has the physique of a man who is in good shape but not particularly muscular or strong, but he's strong enough to whirl Aerith around by her ankles and send her flying, carries Reno over his shoulder like it's nothing, and can out-muscle Cloud, who is explicitly a [Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier). Dio invokes the trope by name in *Rebirth*; he was last scene grappling with Rude and now is covered in bruises and has his arm in a sling, making it clear Rude won their struggle in spite of Dio being as ripped like a bodybuilder.
[Sunglasses at Night](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SunglassesAtNight): Rude, as usual, doesn't take off his shades for any reason. He even carries a bunch of extras on his person in case he loses them.
[Tap on the Head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TapOnTheHead): If Rude specifically targets Tifa or Aerith in battle, he will subdue them with a non-fatal chop to the back of the neck.

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): [Invoked](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Invoked), Out of the three Turks introduced in Part 1 (Tseng, Reno, & himself), Rude is by far the nicest of the Turks but is still antagonistic.

[Unlikely Spare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnlikelySpare): A [Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag) from *Advent Children*, when his sunglasses break during a fight or even just fall off, he always has a few spares tucked away.

[Wouldn't Hit a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldntHitAGirl): [Played With](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedWith). In *Remake*, he'll use the bare minimum force against them, as evidenced by his refusal to do more than light restraining moves against Aerith and Tifa, which is partially justified as his superiors want the former safe and he has a crush on Tifa. In *Rebirth*, he'll have no issue with going all out against a female opponent (to the point that, if switched to either Tifa or Aerith for the first time, he'll muse to himself that he doesn't have a choice).

[Wrestler in All of Us](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrestlerInAllOfUs): His move set includes a [giant swing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Wrestling/ClaudioCastagnoli) to toss party members into each other, a suplex, and a running tackle.
[Ace Custom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AceCustom): Has a bright pink and silver *submachine gun* complete with a cute little keychain charm on the grip.

[Adaptational Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalBadass): Unlike in the original game, where she only used grenades and [kicked](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickChick) during battle, the previews for *Rebirth* show her to be an outright brawler. That said in the original game, stats-wise, she *was* the strongest of the Turks [when stacked up against Reno and Rude](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlierThanTheMale).

[Adaptation Personality Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationPersonalityChange): In the original Elena tends to come off more as a newbie still learning the rope and a bit more insecure. She blurts out Shinra's plans to find Sephiroth in front of the party in the Junon mines, Tseng has to rebuff her for talking too much. Here she's *far* more sure of herself, assertive, and competent - to the point where her bravado actually seems to annoy Rude. She also successfully sends the party falling down the mine with a grenade despite an attempted save from Red.

[Adaptation Relationship Overhaul](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationRelationshipOverhaul): In the original continuity, she was romantically interested in Tseng and he eventually reciprocated and invited her to dinner. In *Rebirth*, neither of them has any romantic interest in the other and Elena's enthusiasm about working alongside Tseng is more about proving herself to her boss in the field.

[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): In an optional encounter in Junon where she's drinking herself silly, you can hear her lament that she thinks Rude and Tseng both hate her, implying her brash cocky attitude is an air she puts on.

[Bratty Teenage Daughter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrattyTeenageDaughter): This is basically her disposition throughout *Rebirth*; while confident and zealous about carrying out her Turk duties, Elena is quick to rant and complain about most of the misfortunes that befall upon her, to the point where Rude (who is temporarily paired up with her while Reno was recuperating) privately wishes his old partner would hurry up and recover.

[Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack): She has one with both Rude and Tseng where they will synchronize their martial arts skills to inflict a powerful beatdown on your party if you don't stagger one of them out of it.
[Dark Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl): She might be a newcomer, but she packs one hell of a punch and has plenty of grenades to back her up.
[Does Not Like Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoesNotLikeSpam): While she does want ice cream to deal with desert heat, she will reject vanilla-flavored ice cream.
[Drowning My Sorrows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrowningMySorrows): She can be found in a bar in Junon, getting drunk and lamenting that she thinks Tseng and Rude both hate her.

[Enhanced Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnhancedPunch): Her Elena Knuckle ability has a lengthy windup before she dashes at you with a powerful punch, she [doesn't exactly stick to the follow-up attack however](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CuteClumsyGirl).

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): A [Naïve Newcomer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NaiveNewcomer) to their respective groups? Both energetic, have some sorts of cockiness and are the youngest members? Elena is literally Yuffie if she was a fighting for Shinra instead of for the good of the world.
[Gun Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunFu): Downplayed to most examples, but she still has a dodge attack where she will fire with her SMG at you midair.
[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): If her Elena Punch misses, she goes tumbling away just like she does in the original game if her punch misses Cloud at Icicle Lodge.
[Naïve Newcomer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NaiveNewcomer): She's *way* more enthusiastic than the Turks actually require.
[New Meat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NewMeat): She's been newly promoted, and she is clearly trying to impress everyone way too hard.
[Older Than She Looks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanSheLooks): She looks like a high-schooler and has a petite appearance, but she is old enough to drink (and get herself drunk) at Junon's bar.

[Perky Female Minion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerkyFemaleMinion): Elena is nothing if not energetic and eager to do her job, much to the annoyance of everyone around her. To her credit, she is a good enough fighter to work in tandem with Rude  (SPOILER)  and later Tseng.
[Savvy Guy, Energetic Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavvyGuyEnergeticGirl): She's the brash, confident girl to contrast Rude's coolheaded professionalism.
[Throw Down the Bomblet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowDownTheBomblet): Elena retains her penchant for explosives from the original game and has several attacks that throw grenades at you.

[Tomboy with a Girly Streak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyWithAGirlyStreak): Dresses in a sleek straight-edge suit and is just as much of a consummate professional [Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) as her three male counterparts, yet has an adorable pretty pink princess submachine gun as part of her arsenal.

['80s Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EightiesHair): He's sporting an undercut mullet. Though admittedly, having slicked back hair would make a certain amount of sense given he's a Speed Freak who likes to ride around *[without a helmet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SafetyGearIsCowardly)*.

[Advertised Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdvertisedExtra): Promotional materials feature him prominently and imply he's going to become a recurring rival to Cloud. In the game proper, he only appears in Chapter 4 and completely leaves the plot afterwards, although not without a declaration that [We Will Meet Again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeWillMeetAgain). He does get a bigger role in *Rebirth* as he is fought two more times in the remakes' second installment.

[Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffablyEvil): A strange case, where he is nice to everyone *EXCEPT* the people on his side, as Roche will haphazardly kill the other Shinra motorcycle troopers without a second thought during the bike chase, but he will politely chat with Cloud all the while. Roche doesn't even seem to really want to kill Cloud and rather is only looking for a a good fight during their duel. If  (SPOILER)  Yuffie  talks to him, he will genuinely refer to Cloud as his friend; not to mention he's very polite to her and can even play a game of Fort Condor with her.
[Agent Peacock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AgentPeacock): He is flamboyant and hammy as hell but also a skilled and highly dangerous fighter as befitting someone who underwent the SOLDIER program.

[Alas, Poor Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlasPoorVillain): Considering Roche wasn't really all that bad to begin with, his fate of  (SPOILER) becoming a Sephiroth Clone after his final fight with Cloud is treated as a very somber moment. Cloud is particularly shaken up by the loss of his [Friendly Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlyEnemy), and the reminder that he could one day share Roche's fate .

[Almighty Janitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlmightyJanitor): Well, "janitor" is relative since he *is* a SOLDIER, but he's only ranked Third Class despite being pretty badass. You even face other SOLDIERS later on and they're only somewhat stronger than the standard mooks they fight alongside. Roche was able to fight Cloud to roughly a draw and shows much more skill on a motorcycle than his fellow Third Class  SOLDIERs  do. *Rebirth* reveals that he is [The Captain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCaptain) of Midgar's mobile unit, implying he is the best biker Shinra has to offer. One has to wonder if all his shenanigans are the only things holding him back from achieving a higher rank, or perhaps he got kicked down due to his reckless behavior.

[Ambiguously Bi](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyBi): He's got some very camp mannerisms and borderline flirts with Cloud during their confrontations but makes a point of acknowledging Jessie's comments because she’s an attractive woman. Nothing concrete is ever said, however. *Rebirth*, on the other hand, has him *blowing a flamboyant kiss* to Cloud.

tropeName: And Then John Was a Zombie
tropeNotes: [And Then John Was a Zombie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndThenJohnWasAZombie):  (SPOILER) Becomes a Sephiroth Clone after succumbing to a combination of the cellular degeneration from the procedure that turned him into a  SOLDIER , Sephiroth's cells that were injected into him by Hojo to increase his performance in preparation for his [Last Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastDance), and the wounds from his final battle with Cloud .

[Arc Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcVillain): Of "Chapter 4: Mad Dash" in *Remake*, being the main pursuer among Shinra's forces to chase after Cloud and Avalanche as they make their way up to the Sector 7 plate.

[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): A strangely friendly example. He ends up killing quite a few of his fellow Shinra troops in his stunts and explosions to make himself look awesome. He's a lot nicer to Cloud and Avalanche as he sees them as way too much fun to have around as people to fight, to the point where the Shinra forces are more scared of getting in Roche's way than facing [Cloud](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneManArmy).

[Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker): A renegade SOLDIER Third Class, Roche loves motorcycles and high speed, and is shown using his bike to engage in [Car Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CarFu) with some Shinra security officers.
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): He's very enthusiastic at the prospect of fighting Cloud one-on-one, to the point of *attacking people on his own side* so they can't interfere.
[Canon Foreigner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonForeigner): He is an original character invented for the Remake.
[The Captain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCaptain): Of Midgar's mobile unit.

[Chaotic Stupid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChaoticStupid): Roche is so beyond the pale just plain weird that even people like Cloud and Jessie, who are used to the fantastical weirdness a world like *Final Fantasy VII Remake* ' s throws at them on a daily basis just cannot process him at all. There is a definite air of "okay, *that* sure happened..." hanging over the denouement to Chapter 4 after he leaves.

[Combat Sadomasochist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatSadomasochist): His lines when being attacked show that he enjoys getting hurt as much as he enjoys inflicting it. To him, it's all part of the thrill.
QUOTE What a wonderful gift you've given to me!<br data-format="\\"/>Oh ho, that's the stuff!<br data-format="\\"/>Once more!<br data-format="\\"/>Simply marvelous!
[Continuity Nod](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContinuityNod): He has the same sword and pauldrons that Zack had as a SOLDIER Second Class in *Crisis Core*.

[Deadly Upgrade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlyUpgrade): After Cloud trounces him for the second time at the Golden Saucer,  (SPOILER) Roche volunteers to undergo experimental enhancements courtesy of Professor Hojo—which make him exponentially stronger at the cost of him undergoing [Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage) and eventually ending up just another Sephiroth Clone .

[Don't You Dare Pity Me!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontYouDarePityMe):  (SPOILER) As the cellular degradation starts to take its toll on his body during his second and final battle with Cloud in *Rebirth*, Cloud notices and begins showing concern, but Roche shuts down any sympathy or concern, wanting nothing more than to have his last battle with Cloud.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): In the Japanese and French version, his name is written and pronounced "Rochey".

[Duel Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DuelBoss): Late in Chapter 4, he shows up for a rematch with Cloud and fights him one-on-one without the interference of either his own Shinra mooks or Cloud's friends in Avalanche.

[Fighting from the Inside](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightingFromTheInside): Despite his  (SPOILER) degeneration into another hood, he still mutters out "My... friend..." when encountered in that form in the Temple of the Ancients, showing that there's still a part of him in there somewhere... which arguably [makes it worse.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FateWorseThanDeath)

[Flash Step](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlashStep): When he gets off his motorcycle to duel Cloud, one of his abilities lets him lunge at Cloud in the manner of a [Single-Stroke Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleStrokeBattle).

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): Roche couldn't be any more different from Cloud if he tried. Both characters are SOLDIERS (or ex-SOLDIER in Cloud's case), have blond hair, are master swordsmen and extremely skilled bikers, and some of Roche's attacks are mirrors of Cloud's own moveset. But in contrast to the stoic and silent Cloud, Roche is loud, bombastic, and over the top. Also, while Cloud gains a following of friends despite his antisocial demeanor, Roche's manic behavior and general disregard for the safety of others make him an outcast among Shinra troops.

[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): Roche appears to be synonymous with the number 4 as he serves as the final boss in Chapter 4 of both *Remake* and *Rebirth*. Throughout the story,  (SPOILER)  he fought Cloud a total of four times, twice in Midgar, once in Junon and finally in Nibelheim, wherein he is branded with an  SC4  tattoo. Upon his last defeat, he is turned into a Sephiroth Clone after succumbing to both his injuries and cellular degeneration .

[Friendly Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlyEnemy): For all his crazed aggression, Roche doesn't hold any genuine animosity towards Cloud, instead of viewing their battles as but a means to satiate his never-ending lust for an adrenaline release. He even goes out of his way to screw over his fellow Shinra by helping Cloud and the other Avalanche members escape certain death, all just to ensure that he and Cloud can someday cross paths again.  (SPOILER) In Yuffie's DLC, he can be found looking for Cloud in Sector 7, and Yuffie is a bit weirded out by how he talks about Cloud.

[The Friend Nobody Likes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFriendNobodyLikes): According to his bio, Roche's reckless, manic behavior and general disregard for the safety of others makes him disliked among Shinra troops. That said, he seems to be much more popular in Junon, where he has an entire audience of troopers who help him set up a gladiator match with Cloud and cheer him on as they watch.

[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): Although disappointed, he takes his losses to Cloud with sportsman-like dignity, preferring to think of them as extra motivation for him to train harder so that he'll stand a better chance the next time they cross swords.
[Gratuitous English](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GratuitousEnglish): In the Japanese version, where he constantly calls Cloud "my friend" in English.
[The Hyena](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHyena): Roche becomes a raving lunatic whenever he's on the motorcycle, doing all sorts of crazy stunts while laughing his heart out.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): He wields Blizzard magic in his second fight with Cloud.

[Jacob Marley Warning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JacobMarleyWarning):  (SPOILER) His last words in *Rebirth*, just before succumbing to his cellular degradation, are warning Cloud that the degradation will claim him as well.

[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): This man always seems to be in a perpetual state of hyperdrive, screaming and moving around with all the subtlety of a jackhammer as he makes his intentions known. The only time he tones it down, somewhat, is whenever he starts waxing poetic about the thrill of competition.

[The Last Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLastDance):  (SPOILER) In *Rebirth*, it's revealed that he's dying from the cellular degradation caused by being infused with Jenova cells, so he decides to go out in one last blaze of glory by having a final duel with Cloud.
[Laughing Mad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughingMad): Roche spends about 75% of his screentime giving off deranged laughter.

[Let's Fight Like Gentlemen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LetsFightLikeGentlemen): On Normal difficulty, he feeds Cloud an elixir before their duel so they can have a fair fight. On Hard difficulty, you aren't so lucky.

[Military Maverick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilitaryMaverick): A member of SOLDIER, he's ostracized by many in the organization due to his antics and general disregard for anyone's safety — with the security officers chasing Cloud, Jessie, Biggs, and Wedge making sure to fall back when he joins the chase.

[Mirror Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MirrorBoss): Roche's attacks in his second battle with Cloud are mirrors of Cloud's own moves. His Combustion Sword is basically Cloud's Braver skill, his Vacuum Wave and Ignition Flame is Cloud's Blade Burst skill, and he can use some of the same magic Cloud can. His fourth battle, meanwhile, uses moves inspired much more strongly by *Sephiroth's* moveset,  (SPOILER) a sign of his impending fate.

tropeName: The Only One Allowed to Defeat You
tropeNotes: [The Only One Allowed to Defeat You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheOnlyOneAllowedToDefeatYou): After the second battle against Cloud, Roche displays this attitude, dispatching a group of Street Sweepers set on mowing down Cloud, Biggs and Wedge while telling the former to "try not to die" before their next duel.

[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): His Ignition Flame skill has him drag his sword along the ground and releasing a wave of fire in Cloud's direction. On Hard Mode, he'll send out three.

[Punch-Clock Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunchClockVillain): During  (SPOILER)  Intermission  he can be found hanging out in the Sector 7 Slums, he doesn't exhibit his usual [Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy) behavior and, while still extremely loud and eccentric, is perfectly capable of blending in with the locals.

[Pungeon Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PungeonMaster): Being a Speed Freak, he can't help but pepper his speech with references to vehicles.
QUOTE **Roche:** You turned the key... The engine roars with excitement. It hungers to be set free!
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): He's aptly named the "Speed Demon," owing to his insane prowess at motorcycling.
[Red Ones Go Faster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOnesGoFaster): His SOLDIER-Class Motorcycle is colored red which matches his fiery personality and his speed demon tendencies.

[Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage): In *Rebirth*,  (SPOILER) his sanity starts nosediving after he volunteers for one of Hojo's experimental procedures, ending with him being reduced to just another Sephiroth clone after his final defeat .
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): He has lightning materia equipped, and uses it liberally during the motorcycle duel segment.

[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): He fires barrages of [Razor Wind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RazorWind) crescents from his sword during his motorcycle-duel with Cloud. Also, in his second fight, his Vacuum Wave skill also has him fire one of these.
[Sword Drag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordDrag): When Roche challenges Cloud to a duel, he's shown dragging his SOLDIER longsword along the ground.

[Symbolically Broken Object](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SymbolicallyBrokenObject): The first hint that his fourth fight with Cloud  (SPOILER) is his last ride is that he trashes his prized red bike just before the fight begins. Sure enough he has his last drive then and there.

[Team Killer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamKiller): Once he gets on that bike, Roche will maim, if not outright slaughter, anyone unfortunate enough to get in the way of his crazed driving without care or remorse. That includes his fellow Shinra troopers just doing their jobs.

[This Cannot Be!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisCannotBe): If the player gets a high enough score for the Junon parade minigame and wins the award for outstanding performance, Roche will scream "No, say it ain't so!"

[Unfriendly Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnfriendlyFire): Roche happily runs over a Shinra grunt during his introduction sequence just so he can have the pleasure of dueling Cloud all by himself. He does it *again* in their second encounter, this time by taking out three Street Sweepers who were about to execute Cloud and his Avalanche allies, for roughly the same reason.

[Villains Out Shopping](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainsOutShopping): During the events of Intermission, Yuffie can find him and challenge him to a game of Fort Condor, while odd he is perfectly personable to her and if you defeating him he will declare her as his friend and hopes they can play again in the future.

[Wild Card](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WildCard): The manic and unpredictable Roche quickly establishes himself as a strong and highly skilled warrior. As a SOLDIER, however, he leaves a lot to be desired, being far more concerned with seeking out hedonistic pleasures than doing his job properly. He'll even turn on his supposed allies in the blink of an eye for any given reason. The only thing consistent with him is that he's willing to lend a hand to anyone who earns his respect, no matter which side they're on.

[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent):
    - He lets Cloud, Jessie, Biggs and Wedge get away due to seeing Cloud as a worthy opponent and wanting another rematch. He even tosses Cloud an Elixir before their personal duel, as he wants to fight Cloud at his full strength. Averted in Hard Mode however where he doesn't toss one to Cloud. - (SPOILER) In *Episode INTERmission *, he begins to also view Yuffie as a worthy rival after she defeats him at Fort Condor.

[Your Days Are Numbered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourDaysAreNumbered):  (SPOILER) *Rebirth* reveals that he's dying from cellular degradation, allegedly caused by his Mako infusion but actually due to Hojo deliberately overdosing him with Jenova cells, and so he decides to spend his final moments with one last duel with Cloud. Sure enough, once the fight ends, he dies shortly after and becomes one of the robed ones.
[Arch-Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy): To Zack. Genesis constantly antagonizes him through *Crisis Core Reunion* and takes this role as Zack’s answer to Cloud's Sephiroth.
[Author Appeal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AuthorAppeal): He was heavily based on Gackt, a Japanese pop star that Tetsuya Nomura was a fan of at the time of the original PSP version's development.
[Badass Longcoat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassLongcoat): He wears a long red coat. One of his fanclubs even calls themselves "Red Leather".

[Beta Test Baddie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BetaTestBaddie): To Sephiroth. Genesis was just one of many people around the world who looked up to Sephiroth and wanted to be just like him. Learning that they were made from separate, competing branches of the Jenova Project, just heightened Genesis' jealousy of and ambition to surpass him.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): His weapon is a massive red rapier, to parallel Sephiroth's Masamune.

[Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad): For *Crisis Core Reunion*.  (SPOILER) [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Downplayed) in that Hollander is manipulating him for his own ends and Genesis is more desperate than evil. That said Genesis outlives Hollander and stopping him is the climax of the game.
[Blonde, Brunette, Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlondeBrunetteRedhead): He's the Redhead to Sephiroth's Blonde and Angeal's Brunette.

[The Bully](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBully): He seems to take pleasure in bullying and childishly tormenting Zack just to get a rise out of him. His favorite go-to tactic involves insulting him and calling forth a Summon before disappearing. He also takes time to torment Sephiroth with truth of his origins in Nibelheim, *not* because he felt he needed to know, but *just* to hurt him. This ends up being a ***Biblical-scale*** [Gone Horribly Right](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoneHorriblyRight). He indeed manages to corrupt Sephiroth, but to such an extent that it makes Genesis come off as *just small.*
[Clipped-Wing Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClippedWingAngel): After Genesis Avatar is defeated, Zack must fight Genesis again in human form.

[Cold Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColdHam): He tends to be pretty even-toned and doesn't raise his voice a lot, but he still puts a lot of weight and drama into his sentences, especially if he's quoting LOVELESS.
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): His rapier is a giant red blade that he can imbue with magic to fight.
[Disney Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyDeath): Genesis fell into a reactor, yet it becomes apparent later on that he survived.
[Easily Forgiven](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EasilyForgiven): Zack feels sorry for him and lets him live.

[Everyone Is Jesus in Purgatory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneIsJesusInPurgatory): In-universe, Genesis is obsessed with LOVELESS and has written papers on what it might mean. As his condition and sanity deteriorate and his desperation for a cure intensifies, he starts drawing parallels between the events of *Crisis Core* and LOVELESS, and becomes convinced it is some sort of holy prophecy or legend that he must fulfill.

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart):
    - To Zack. His quest to become a hero contrasts with the same quest Genesis Rhapsodos undertakes, but whereas the latter's feelings of entitlement to the moniker of "hero" lead to obsession and downfall, Zack's quest to "become a hero" has less to do with personal glory and more with making the world a better place. Zack's will to become a hero motivated him to think for himself and to be guided by his moral compass and sense of justice, whereas Genesis's obsession with becoming a hero drove him to challenge those he saw as hindrances and a need to prove himself as superior to others. Both joined SOLDIER inspired by stories of the hero First Class Sephiroth, striving to emulate him, and both fall from Shinra's graces after learning of the company's corrupt ways. In an inversion of a typical hero-villain story dynamic, Zack dies whereas Genesis lives. - To Angeal as well. They are both SOLDIERs of Project G, both were inspired by Sephiroth to join SOLDIER and both can create copies of themselves. However Genesis and his copies are associated with black wings, whereas Angeal and his copies are associated with white wings, alluding to angel/fallen angel imagery. Both struggle with the man/monster dynamic, Genesis embracing it as it gives him special powers he can exploit to attain his goals, whereas Angeal begins to loath himself.

[Evil Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilRedhead): A ginger villain who massacres a town (including his adoptive parents), turns those loyal to him into copies of himself, and helps drive Sephiroth over the edge at Nibelheim.

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Of Sephiroth, obviously. Genesis was intended to be a [Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil) to him in personality and appearance, so he copies many elements of Sephiroth's design while other elements are entirely different. This is probably at least partially intentional in-universe — like many kids, Genesis idolized Sephiroth during the Wutai War and wanted to be just like him, so emulating his wardrobe and giving it his own personal touch may have been a deliberate choice on his part.
[Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss): Of *Crisis Core*. Not counting the scripted [Hopeless Boss Fight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessBossFight) that follows.

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): To Sephiroth. They're both famous First Class  SOLDIERs  that go rogue from Shinra and seek divine power. However, Sephiroth does so because he comes to think he's an Ancient and should rule the planet; Genesis is trying to save his own life and is resorting to desperate stretches of reason to find a way. Even their designs play into this; Genesis is short-haired, right-handed, has a wing on his left side, and wields a massive straight-bladed sword that he infuses with magic, while Sephiroth is long-haired, [left-handed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeftHandedMirror), with a wing on the right side, and he wields a katana that he never empowers. Also contrast Genesis' demonic-looking Genesis Avatar form with the angelic Safer Sephiroth, and Genesis' belief that he is a monster with Sephiroth's [Godhood Seeker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodhoodSeeker).
[Freudian Trio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianTrio): Forms one with Angeal and Sephiroth in *Crisis Core Reunion*, as the Id; driven by emotion and personal ambition.

[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): Twice during the game:
    - The first is during the flashback when he's fighting Angeal and Sephiroth in a training simulation. Despite his ego driving him to turn the match into a one-on-one with Sephiroth and even punt Angeal away when he tries to stop him from taking things too far, Genesis accepts defeat when Sephiroth lands a clean hit on him. [He even tells them not to worry about his minor injury](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustAFleshWound), which becomes bitterly ironic considering that it kickstarted both his physical, and eventual [mental degradation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage). - The second is when Zack defeats him during the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) battle. Having been forced to accept that the "gift of the Goddess" will not save him, he makes no further attempt to resist Zack, and his final words imply that he considers being reunited with his old friends the real gift and dream come true.

[Green-Eyed Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreenEyedMonster): He's jealous of Sephiroth's status as [The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce) (as well as the face of  SOLDIER ), which drives him to attempt to take him on alone during what was meant to be a light-hearted training session.
QUOTE **Genesis:** After all, your glory should have been mine.
[The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy): In *Crisis Core*, he's the character that the game's events revolve around.

[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): Genesis is this with Angeal and Sephiroth before  (SPOILER) [his separation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParagonAlwaysRebels) .

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): When he was a young man, he invented Banora White juice, squeezed from freshly harvested dumpapples, winning a local competition and putting the small and relatively obscure village of Banora on the map. Posters of Banora White juice can still be seen all over the world in *Remake* and *Rebirth*, cementing the drink's popularity.

[Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination): In several ways.
    - As a SOLDIER, he's a normal human that has been injected with Jenova's cells. However they manifest differently in him than in Sephiroth due to the different nature of how they received the cells, which is the major reason for his rebellion against Shinra; Genesis' genes are unstable and when he's injured in a sparring match, his body begins to undergo cellular degradation. This first shows itself when he manifests a black wing, but as the game goes on and his condition worsens, his hair lightens to white, and his skin begins to crack and scar. - The Genesis Copies created by grafting his cells onto humans take on his facial appearance and hair, but they also experience the same degradation he does at an accelerated rate. The result is that while a few of them look identical to Genesis, others look even more monstrous than he does to the point they're barely recognizable as human anymore, such as the [G-Warrior strains](https://finalfantasy.fandom.com/wiki/File:G_Devastator_Artwork.jpg)◊. - As the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) (SPOILER) in his Genesis Avatar form, Genesis transforms into a giant, armored version of himself and wields a variant of his rapier.

[Ink-Suit Actor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InkSuitActor): His appearance is heavily based on his voice actor, Gackt. All the way back in *Dirge of Cerberus* on the [PS 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PS2), when the character was originally teased, they didn't even bother with the ink suit; Gackt got into costume and performed in front of a green screen to be put into the game's secret ending. Gackt had a hand in the design of his outfit.

[It's All About Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllAboutMe): He leaves SOLDIER in order to find a cure for his condition. This would be fine, except he murders a bunch of innocent people and subjects others to horrendous experimentation at Hollander's hands. He also pushes Sephiroth further into madness because he's attempting to goad the latter into curing him. Needless to say, his selfish actions do not end well for *anyone*.

[Karma Houdini](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmaHoudini): He instigated a war, killed his own parents, basically wiped out his hometown's population, subjected an immense amount of innocent people to Hollander's experments, and his presence helped drive Sephiroth over the edge at Nibelheim. Yet he's the only one of the  SOLDIERs  who survives the entire ordeal.

[Kick the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog): He spends quite a lot of time mocking Angeal and Sephiroth's inner conflicts, turns the  SOLDIERs  loyal to him into copies, and helps kick off the massacre at Nibelheim by pushing Sephiroth over the edge with a [breaking speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakThemByTalking).

[Laser Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserBlade): He can channel magic into his sword, giving it the appearance of a lightsaber. Further, the hand motion he employs to activate this resembles the [Trope namer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Series/MetalHeroes).
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): He fights with sword combos and magic in equal turn, and powers magic into his sword to strengthen it.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): "Genesis" of course parallels Sephiroth's name in Biblical symbolism, but it also means "birth" or "origin". Combined with the origin of his last name, he is "the original epic poem", referring both to his obsession with LOVELESS, and the idea that in-universe he was the original rebel SOLDIER and committed acts that Sephiroth would later repeat.
    - More literally, while Genesis isn't the cause behind all of major problems in the world of *Final Fantasy VII* (that can be laid on Hojo's hands), he *did* instigate Sephiroth's loss of sanity in Nibelheim, and thus is partially to blame for Sephiroth becoming such a major threat to the planet in *VII* and later works. His name also implies that he was the first SOLDIER to be injected with Jenova cells, which would lead to Sephiroth being the perfection of it. - Lastly, his last name is close to "rhapsody", to mean an enthusiastic expression of one's feelings. While cool-headed about it, Genesis is not shy about expressing how he feels about something.
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel): Empowers himself with the Goddess Materia to transform into Genesis Avatar.

[The Paragon Always Rebels](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParagonAlwaysRebels): While not as revered or powerful as Sephiroth, Genesis was still one of Shinra's greatest warriors before he turns on them, and when he defects he takes a large number of other SOLDIER members with him.
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): He prefers fire and fire-like attacks, such as Flash, Homing, and Dark Energy.
[Power Degeneration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerDegeneration): The procedure that granted him his powers is also what's going to kill him if he doesn't find a cure.
[Psycho Prototype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychoPrototype): He's the original Project G SOLDIER. Finding out about it is what helped drive him to evil.

[Psychopathic Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychopathicManchild): Genesis's most defining trait is, without a doubt, his complete and total immaturity. Like Zack, he too strives to be a hero more than anything, but unlike Zack, who admired and looked up to Sephiroth as his role model, Genesis *couldn't stand* living in his shadow, and took every opportunity he could at whatever pissing match could be mustered. Eventually, Sephiroth becomes completely exhausted with his competitive streak and couldn't care less if he was the hero of his twisted recreation of LOVELESS. Then there's the fact that, if he can't be cured of his condition, he will if nothing else attempt to take the entire world with him. While the fact that he's sick and dying is indeed lamentable and he deserves sympathy and help, his decision to throw a world-ending tantrum doesn't exactly win him many points.

tropeName: Red and Black and Evil All Over
tropeNotes: [Red and Black and Evil All Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedAndBlackAndEvilAllOver): Wears black pants and a top under his red coat, though he's less evil and more a desperate jerk as the game goes on. This color scheme extends to the Genesis Copies, who variably wear replicas of Genesis' outfit or modified Shinra SOLDIER or infantry uniforms that have been recolored red and black.

[Remember the New Guy?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RememberTheNewGuy): Played with. No other version of the Nibelheim Incident has any mention or appearance by Genesis. However, the way he appears in *Crisis Core* allows him to be there without actually retconning the event's other depictions — he appears when Zack and Sephiroth enter the reactor, and the only version of that specific scene that has been shown across the series is the one where Cloud is in Zack's place, so Genesis's absence could be given a [Hand Wave](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandWave) as one of many inconsistencies in Cloud's memories. These inconsistencies are in fact constantly brought up by Tifa in *Rebirth.*
    - From a broader perspective, both Genesis and Angeal were never mentioned in *VII* alongside Sephiroth, despite both being close friends of Sephiroth, having fan clubs, and major roles in a war felt throughout the world.

[Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage): Undergoes one throughout the game, with his dialogue devolving into cryptic and borderline-incoherent recitations of LOVELESS the more desperate he gets. It takes being directly spurned by the "goddess" he was seeking out for him to (somewhat) come to his senses and accept the futility of his actions.
[Self-Made Orphan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfMadeOrphan): He killed his adoptive parents, though we never find out who his biological parents are.

[Sissy Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SissyVillain): His English voice actor goes down this route, and the [Bishoneny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Bishonen) appearance, flamboyant hand gestures and *constant* recital of LOVELESS just add to it.

[Then Let Me Be Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThenLetMeBeEvil): Implied with his statement to Zack that as a monster, he has neither dreams nor honor (admittedly a claim that is later disproven by his desire to regain his pride as a SOLDIER).

[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn):  (SPOILER)  He's one to Hollander who manipulated him into going against his former friends on the pretense that he can cure Genesis' degradation, even though Hollander has no intentions of doing so until Hollander himself suffers from degradation .

tropeName: Used to Be a Sweet Kid
tropeNotes: [Used to Be a Sweet Kid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UsedToBeASweetKid): According to Angeal's mother, he was a nice guy growing up who got along well with the few friends he had, and was even the one who put the small village of Banora on the map thanks to his juice.

[What Happened to the Mouse?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHappenedToTheMouse): The last he's see in *Crisis Core Reunion*, he lost consciousness and was taken away - presumably to Deepground - by Weiss and Nero. While those two would show up again in *Episode Intermission*, Genesis has yet to reappear since he was taken.

[Wicked Pretentious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WickedPretentious): He's one of the world's leading scholars on LOVELESS and is implied to have published writings about his theories to its meaning. Normally, this may have had him come across as [Wicked Cultured](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WickedCultured), but his tendency to spout [Meaningless Meaningful Words](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaninglessMeaningfulWords) at the drop of a hat turns him into a downplayed version of this trope. It doesn't help that literally *every other named character* familiar with LOVELESS considers it [absolute dreck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StylisticSuck).

[With Friends Like These...](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WithFriendsLikeThese): On the giving end. He's extremely petty towards Angeal and especially Sephiroth, whether out of not taking their concerns seriously (Angeal) or simple jealousy (Sephiroth). It's pretty telling that Sephiroth tells him he can *rot* after everything he pulls.

[Wound That Will Not Heal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoundThatWillNotHeal): When Angeal interrupts his duel with Sephiroth, his sword breaks in two and part of the blade strikes Genesis in the shoulder. While Genesis treats it as [Only a Flesh Wound](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyAFleshWound), it ends up not healing and getting worse, kicking off his cellular degradation.

[Animalistic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalisticAbomination): The Angeal Copies are created by grafting his cells onto monsters; the Ahriman, Sahagin, Griffon, and Guard Hound.  (SPOILER) As Angeal Penance he fuses with one each of these copies, and the result is a centaur-like chimera with Angeal's torso and head on the front and various parts of the copies making up the rest of his body.

[Anti-Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiVillain): He's not a villain at all, he's just trying to do the right thing and sometimes is on the side of Shinra's enemies. The few times Angeal acts outright antagonistic to Zack is when he's in a [Then Let Me Be Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThenLetMeBeEvil) mood.

[The Artifact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheArtifact): Not Angeal himself, but the Buster Sword in the *Reunion* remake. In the original *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCoreFinalFantasyVII)*, the sword had a much more decorative and ornate grip and crossguard design inherited from *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/AdventChildren)*, befitting its origins as a more decorative weapon that justifies Angeal withholding from using it. In *Reunion* it was changed back to the original *VII* design that *[Final Fantasy VII Remake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIIRemake)* used, a far more industrial and iron-wrought design.
[Artistic Age](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtisticAge): He's 25, but acts much older.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): The original wielder of the Buster Sword.
[Big Brother Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherMentor): To Zack, instilling with him what it means to be a true SOLDIER and why those values are important.
[Blonde, Brunette, Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlondeBrunetteRedhead): He's the Brunette to Sephiroth's Blonde and Genesis's Redhead.

[The Bore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBore): He's regarded with the highest respect and honor among SOLDIER operatives, but to his friends, he's a [legendary nag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDreaded) who constantly lectures them about dreams and honor. Even *Sephiroth* has to quietly put up with them.

[Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination): As Angeal Penance, he's a  (SPOILER) bipedal chimera-entity formed from several Angeal Copies, with Angeal's face and chest on the torso.

[Freudian Trio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianTrio): Forms one with Sephiroth and Genesis in *Crisis Core*, as the Ego; the level-headed mediator between the two. Fully demonstrated in the duel between the two when Angeal has to intervene to stop them from taking it too far.

[Gold and White Are Divine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldAndWhiteAreDivine): The Angeal Copies created from his cells take on a prominently silver, white, and gold color scheme.  (SPOILER) This naturally extends to Angeal Penance as well, a chimera of the copies with Angeal himself.

[Good Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodCounterpart): To Genesis.  (SPOILER) While Genesis rebels against Shinra to heal himself, Angeal does it because he's torn between loyalty to Shinra and loyalty to his oldest and best friend. As well, while they're both experiments of Project G, Angeal is the "perfect" result of Hollander's efforts and has a different set of abilities than Genesis does.
[Good Wings, Evil Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodWingsEvilWings): In contrast to Genesis and Sephiroth's black wings, Angeal's wings are white and pure.

[Heel–Face Revolving Door](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceRevolvingDoor): Being torn between his self-loathing, his loyalty to Shinra, his brotherly affection for both Sephiroth and Genesis, and his desire to protect Zack, which side Angeal is on changes in almost every scene he's in.  (SPOILER) He ultimately opts for [Suicide by Cop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuicideByCop) at Zack's hands in order to deal with his inability to resolve his inner turmoil.
[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): Angeal is this to Genesis and Sephiroth  (SPOILER) [before his death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuicideByCop) .

[Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination): He's a SOLDIER, so he's been infused with Jenova cells and Mako energy to create this.  (SPOILER) As a Project G experiment though he's even more on the "abomination" side than normal SOLDIER members.
[I Cannot Self-Terminate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ICannotSelfTerminate): Pretty much the reason why he  (SPOILER) transformed and fought Zack to the death.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Angeal = Angel. Lampshaded when Zack says his wings are those of an angel, not a monster. Secondly, Hewley: he's hewn in two due to his conflicting loyalties. Thirdly, Angeal Penance, representing  (SPOILER) Angeal's desire to invoke [Death Equals Redemption](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathEqualsRedemption) by forcing Zack to kill him and take up his legacy .

[Meaningless Meaningful Words](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaninglessMeaningfulWords): He uses the words "dream" and "honor" a lot. As in pretty much every other sentence. Usually when they're in an improper context. Sephiroth lampshades it when he tells Zack about receiving "one of Angeal's famous lectures".
[Mentor Occupational Hazard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorOccupationalHazard): Shockingly, this mentor to Zack and hero of Shinra you've never heard of does not survive the game.

[Mistaken for Murderer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MistakenForMurderer): Zack is horrified when he sees Angeal standing over his own mother's dead body, thinking that his mentor had just committed matricide. It's only later that Angeal reveals that his mother Gillian actually [killed herself](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToSuicide) since she couldn't bear the guilt of her role in Project G any longer.
[No Cure for Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCureForEvil): Averted,  (SPOILER) End of Gluttony restores his HP.
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel):  (SPOILER) He merges with other Angeal Copies  to become Angeal Penance.
[Ornamental Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrnamentalWeapon): The Buster Sword costs so much for his parents to have custom-made for him that he dislikes using it to avoid damaging it.
[The Paragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParagon): Along with Sephiroth and Genesis, he's one of Shinra's most famous and respected  SOLDIERs , and many aspire to his example.
[The Paragon Always Rebels](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParagonAlwaysRebels): And he ends up siding with Genesis.
[Power Gives You Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerGivesYouWings): Just like Genesis and Sephiroth, though he gets two and his are white.
[Rapid-Fire Fisticuffs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidFireFisticuffs): The DMW attack associated with him, Rush Assault, is a flurry of punches and kicks.
[Real Men Wear Pink](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RealMenWearPink): An in-game email from his fan club states that he loves dogs, cooking, and gardening.
[Team Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamDad): To Zack, and most of the SOLDIER.
[Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeNaming): As Angeal Penance, all his special attacks are named after the Seven Deadly Sins.
[What Have I Become?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHaveIBecome): He does not take the revelation of what he really is well.

[Connected All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConnectedAllAlong): *Remake* reveals that he personally knew *Cloud* specifically, but their relationship past that is a mystery as the two are never seen interacting in *Crisis Core Reunion.*
[The Faceless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFaceless): He never takes off his helmet so we have no idea what he looks like beneath it.

[Mauve Shirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MauveShirt): He has enough screentime to be more than just an anonymous SOLDIER, but not enough to really be considered part of the core cast, even within the single title he appears in.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): He knows a lot about what goes on in Shinra that he explains to Zack.

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): Arguably the nicest guy in SOLDIER after Zack, so it's not much wonder why the two are close friends. He is never anything less than loyal and helpful, if a little bit annoying and overbearing.
[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): To Zack, to the point he says in his last emails after Zack awakens at Nibelheim that he's gonna leave Shinra to find him and help him.

[What Happened to the Mouse?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHappenedToTheMouse): His final email says he's going to come look for Zack, but we never find out his fate. He gets namedropped in *Remake*, but nothing past that.

[Adaptational Early Appearance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalEarlyAppearance): In the original timeline, Deepground didn't appear until the events of *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*. The *Final Fantasy VII Remake Ultimania* confirms that the secret laboratory where the Failed Experiment and Type-0 Behemoth are fought is part of Deepground, and in Yuffie's episode in *Intergrade*, Deepground soldiers as well as Nero are sent against her and Sonon, and a digital recreation of Weiss appears as an [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss).

[Elite Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EliteMook): The Deepground  SOLDIERs  are much more powerful than the Third Class  SOLDIERs , including having the ability to turn invisible. They're also portrayed in cutscenes as being far more competent than their peers, able to swiftly corral Yuffie and Sonon into an enclosed space using group tactics much more professional than anything the Shinra rank and file are ever shown to be capable of.

[Malevolent Masked Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MalevolentMaskedMen): The rank-and-file Deepground Troopers are shown wearing full-face masks with an eye motif in the trailer for the *Intergrade* DLC.

[Rogues' Gallery Transplant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoguesGalleryTransplant): In the original timeline, Deepground was involved with Genesis Rhapsodos and Vincent Valentine. While Genesis is confirmed to exist in the remake, <sup>note </sup>  Hojo mentions G-Type  SOLDIERs  while discussing breeding Aerith.  the *Interlude* DLC has Deepground troopers attack Yuffie and Sonon when they infiltrate Shinra's HQ.

[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): Deepground is a top-secret Shinra research facility where clandestine experiments with Mako  (SPOILER) and Jenova cells  are performed, ostensibly in order to refine and improve the SOLDIER Program. The Failed Experiment and Unknown Entities, as the former's moniker suggests, were deemed failures and put into stasis; while the more-successful Deepground Soldiers and Weiss appear in the *Intergrade* DLC.

[Adaptational Early Appearance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalEarlyAppearance): In the original timeline, Weiss didn't appear until the events of *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*, which is set several years after the events of *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*; with a brief cameo in *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)* being his chronologically-earliest appearance. In the trailer for *[Final Fantasy VII Remake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIIRemake): Intergrade*, he is shown ordering Deepground Soldiers to hunt for Yuffie,  (SPOILER) but in the episode itself he gets little more than a brief cameo .

[Adaptational Modesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalModesty): In *Dirge of Cerberus*, Weiss was chronically shirtless. In *Final Fantasy VII Remake: Intergrade*, he's shown wearing a white jacket over his bare chest.

[All Your Powers Combined](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllYourPowersCombined): In his combat simulator battle he can shift to using Azul's [cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFG) and Rosso's [sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoubleWeapon) as the fight wears on.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation):  (SPOILER) It's not clear whether the [Call-Forward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CallForward) is just a reference to *Dirge of Cerberus*, a memory that already happened with the implication that Weiss knows about the future, or perhaps even worse, a demonstration that Hojo has *already* uploaded his mind into Shinra's network and may have already hijacked Weiss' body. The latter seems unlikely as the trailer implies that Hojo is still active on his own so Weiss and Hojo are pretty much separated at this point.
[Anime Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair): Weiss is shown to have hair even spikier than Cloud's.

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): After Chadley creates a data replica of him, suffice to say, he thinks really, *really* highly of himself and his abilities. Crosses over with [Awesome Ego](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomeEgo). QUOTE **Chadley:** What do you think of your new form, Weiss? We've replicated everything about you, from thought patterns to stress responses. You should, however, notice some improvements due to my latest update. Indeed, I'd venture to say you're stronger now than you've ever been. QUOTE **Weiss:** Stronger than I've ever been... A big claim, little man.
[BFG](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFG): After losing half of his health, Weiss ditches his swords in favor of a rapid-firing heavy machine gun, trading mobility for sustained long-distance firepower.

[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): He's clearly enjoying himself in battle: at the start of his fight he delivers a [To the Pain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToThePain) speech of the many ways he's going to kill you.  (SPOILER) He's also irritated to learn that, as a VR simulation meant only to test his opponents, he won't be able to actually kill them. 
QUOTE **Weiss:** They shall be slashed, strangled and slaughtered. Beaten, stabbed and crushed... Garroted and impaled. Shot and executed...without mercy. Now...let the hunt begin!

[Call-Forward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CallForward):
    - The cutscenes bookending his boss fight are loaded with references to *Dirge of Cerberus*. Before the fight, he directly quotes his threatening monologue from that game; after being defeated, he alludes to (SPOILER) Hojo's [Brain Uploading](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainUploading) plot, interspersed with images of Weiss shirtless and Hojo . The significance of these allusions, if any, are unclear. - His Azul phase has a number of calls to Azul in *Dirge of Cerberus*. Azul's Arch form was based on a militarized version of the recurring monster Behemoth and Azul was taken down by being impaled on his gun and blasted. One of Weiss' moves during the phase is to sprout Behemoth horns at the end of the gun to grab enemies at the end of the barrel and blast them. Twice over Azul recovered when left alone after taking damage, Weiss can recover health if he isn't stopped in time. And lastly, Arch Azul was invulnerable to normal attacks so using magic was the best measure against him, Weiss' Azul phase cannot be physically damaged but lacks extra defense against magical attacks.

[The Dreaded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDreaded): He and the rest of the Tsviets are one of Shinra's best kept secrets for a good reason. Even Chadley, who casually recreates Summon data and materia, was extremely reticent on having data of Weiss recreated.
[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): In battle, he wields two gun-katanas.

[Even Evil Has Loved Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasLovedOnes): Weiss seems to care about Nero. During their shared scene, he asks him if he slept well and if he looks forward to his future hunt. Unlike the way he talks to others, referring to them as idiots, he speaks to Nero as his equal in a gentle, respectful way.

[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): In his Rosso phase he becomes even faster and stronger, rapidly moving across the arena in flashes of light to perform deadly sword combos. However, unlike his other forms he has no means of damage resistance at all and all attacks hit at normal power, which also means he's more vulnerable to his Stagger gauge getting built up.
[Iaijutsu Practitioner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IaijutsuPractitioner): His Immaculate End is him sheathing his sword before striking as he draws it.

[The Juggernaut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheJuggernaut): In his boss fight he is obscenely hard to take down: he resists all forms of damage, moves and attacks extremely quickly, and his attacks pack a big punch. It's only once he's staggered that he loses his damage resistance, giving players a small window to wail on him before he recovers.
[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): Weiss is shown with his signature dual katanas crossed behind his back in the *Final Fantasy VII Remake: Intergrade* trailer.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): He moves fast, hits hard, and it takes a lot of punishment to take him down.

[Living Emotional Crutch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingEmotionalCrutch): Implied to be one to Nero. His younger brother is considerably less erratic in his presence and Nero even calls him his "only light". Whenever Nero is hurt during his battle with Yuffie and Sonon, he also calls for Weiss like a child would do.

[Mirror Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MirrorCharacter): As presented in *Remake*, Weiss is very much like Sephiroth — an arrogant and condescending swordsman who is one of the most powerful members of Shinra's military, and both are distinguished by their usage of katanas, white hair, and [No Shirt, Long Jacket](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoShirtLongJacket) outfits. However, they also contrast sharply — Weiss is more emotive than Sephiroth, he dual-wields two normal-length katanas with gun barrels instead of the Masamune, his hair is spiked and short instead of long and flowing, and his coat is white while Sephiroth's is black. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) is that this trope is why Weiss was included as a new boss in the *Intergrade* DLC, because he's a powerful enemy aside from Sephiroth that fit the role of an [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss) in the combat simulator.

[Mix-and-Match Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MixAndMatchWeapon): Weiss's main weapons are a pair of gun-katanas, while his secondary weapon is a high-tech machine gun equipped with retractable pincers.

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): In the *Intergrade* DLC he's added to Shinra's combat simulator as a new challenge for Cloud and his allies.  (SPOILER) The real Weiss however is not fought, either by Cloud or Yuffie.
[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): He talks to Nero in a polite and respectful way.

[Rogues' Gallery Transplant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoguesGalleryTransplant): Weiss' first appearance in *Dirge of Cerberus* pitted him against Vincent Valentine, while the *Final Fantasy VII Remake: Intergrade* trailer shows him and the rest of Deepground coming into conflict with Yuffie Kisaragi. In the game itself, however, he only makes a brief appearance and isn't directly fought at all.
[Slasher Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherSmile): His expression when his face is revealed in the *Final Fantasy VII Remake: Intergrade* trailer.

[Smug Super](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmugSuper):  (SPOILER) When Chadley claims that the digitized copy of Weiss has been upgraded to be even stronger, Weiss is skeptical of the idea that a digital version of him could possibly replicate his full power to begin with, much less enhance him further.

[The Starscream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStarscream): Although he's a part of an organization that makes him subservient for Shinra, he has no respect for their personnel, and his official biography implies he's waiting for a chance to turn on Shinra and seek revenge.
[Superboss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Superboss): The strongest enemy in *Remake Intergrade*, who can be challenged in the main story after Yuffie's episode is cleared.

[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): Weiss is a product of Deepground — a top-secret facility used to create elite  SOLDIERs  — and like Sephiroth his white hair is an indicator of the superior power he possesses as a product of the experiments performed on him by Shinra.
[Total Party Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TotalPartyKill): If the party isn't doing well enough against him, he'll use Immaculate End to instantly deal 9999 unblockable damage to them.
[White Hair, Black Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteHairBlackHeart): Weiss is an elite member of SOLDIER and an arrogant warrior, as emphasized by his snow-white hair.

[Adaptational Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalJerkass): In *Dirge of Cerberus*, Nero was cruel but he was more focused on his goal to revive his brother and just absorbed his enemies that stood in his way. Here he is constantly [Laughing Mad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughingMad) while tearing his enemies and allies alike and enjoys inflicting pain as much as receiving it. However, considering Weiss is still alive during the events of Intermission, this might just be what Nero is like when he isn't guided by a specific objective.

[Adaptational Wimp](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalWimp): In *Dirge of Cerberus*, Nero simply absorbed Yuffie with his darkness and the only reason why Vincent could defeat him was because he was immune to darkness due to Chaos's power in him. Here, Yuffie and Sonon are able to hold on their own against Nero in a boss battle.  (SPOILER)  They actually even managed to damage him and force him to remove his limiters. However, while he does acknowledge them as [Worthy Opponents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponents), his [Laughing Mad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughingMad) indicates that he wasn't going all-out due to wanting to take his time to toy with them first, and he ends up faking that they defeated him only to then reveal himself to be alive and fine and stab Sonon and force Yuffie to escape.

[Adaptation Personality Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationPersonalityChange): In the original, Nero was very quiet, calm and collected. While he showed pleasure in killing, he cared more about his goal and only snapped whenever his brother was threatened. Here, Nero is way crazier, nihilistic, shows delight in freely slaughtering his opponents and allies alike, is prone to [Laughing Mad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughingMad), and loves pain inflicted on himself and others. His attitude is way closer to his comrade Rosso the Crimson in *Dirge of Cerberus*. Furthermore, in *Dirge of Cerberus*, Nero was able to work in team to revive his brother and simply let Azul die when the latter failed against Vincent. In Intermission, Nero kills his allies and admits that there is no team in Deepground. However, this change may be explained due to Intermission happening three years before Dirge of Cerberus events so [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) may have happened.

[Ambiguously Bi](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyBi): Beside his obsession with Weiss and his comments that may sound not-so-brotherly sometimes, there is also his behavior toward Sonon and Yuffie during battle, especially his line focusing on their lips when he grabs one of them. (SPOILER) He also grabs Sonon and embraces him in a quite intimate way before taking him into darkness after fatally injuring him.
    - His line in (SPOILER) *Rebirth*, takes step further when Yuffie has a vision of him with Sonon.
QUOTE **Nero:** If you don't come to claim him, I can always keep him for myself.
[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): Nero is a sadistic nihilist who delights in suffering and death, both his own and in causing it to others.
[Barrier Warrior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarrierWarrior): His Veil of Woe skill has him conjure a barrier of darkness that repels attacks.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): *Do not* interrupt him when he's in the middle of a good fight. The scientists observing his battle with Yuffie and Sonon learn this the hard way.

[Big Brother Worship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherWorship): His shared scene with his brother involves Weiss telling him that scientists wish to digitally replicate him. Nero said that they would never be able to replicate the real Weiss. It displays how much Nero admires his brother.

[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): Like his brother Weiss, he enjoys a good fight, telling Weiss that it's been too long since his last hunt. During the boss fight, when his powers start going out of control and the scientists attempt to restrain him, he lashes out and kills them all for interrupting his fight.

[Bound and Gagged](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoundAndGagged): [Played With](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedWith) in his appearance. His main outfit consists of a straightjacket and muzzle, but if anything they are more symbolic as he is easily capable of breaking out his "bonds" and his muzzle doesn't prevent him from actually speaking. [It may help to show that the scientist that believed they had him contained really had no control of him whatsoever.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleOfSymbolism)

[Casting a Shadow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastingAShadow): Nero fights using darkness-based abilities, which he can use to create [Combat Tentacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatTentacles) and a health-draining status effect. He can also empower his weapons with dark energy. His Umbral Shell skill has him enhance his pistols to fire darkness-enhanced bullets and he can empower his wings with dark energy to turn them into Abyssal Wings, making them larger to increase the strength and range of his physical attacks. He can also create solid objects out of darkness, with his Salvo skill having him creating two pistols made from darkness to use in conjunction with his regular pistols.
[Combat Sadomasochist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatSadomasochist): He finds the pain that Yuffie and Sonon inflict upon him during their battle to be exquisite.
[Combat Tentacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatTentacles): His darkness powers typically manifest as shadowy tendrils that can consume and absorb anything they touch.
[Cradling Your Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CradlingYourKill): Subtle but  (SPOILER)  he does this to Sonon before taking him along in the darkness.

[Damage Over Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamageOverTime): The main gimmick of his boss fight. Nero's darkness attacks can inflict a status effect that will rapidly drain Yuffie and Sonon's health and should their health reach critical, he'll use his Soul Erosion skill to finish them off by applying the effect directly. In the third phase of the fight, he'll unleash his Dark Matter skill, temporarily covering the entire floor with darkness that will drain the party's health.
[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): His Disembowel skill has him dive at the party with his wings.
[The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon): To Scarlet in the *Intergrade* DLC who summons him from Deepground in order to kill Yuffie and Sonon.

[Dragon with an Agenda](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonWithAnAgenda): While he acts as [The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon) for Scarlet,  (SPOILER) his last scene involving him taking Sonon away may imply that he has plans in mind. What his plans are remain to be seen.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): His very first scene has him having a pleasant conversation with Weiss, showcasing their brotherly bond. The next scene with him has him killing his fellow Deepground troops by absorbing them with his darkness, showcasing his ruthless and sadistic nature.

[Even Evil Has Loved Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasLovedOnes): While he doesn't view such things as "team" and "allies" in Deepground, it's pretty clear that Nero loves his brother very much.

[Faking the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FakingTheDead):  (SPOILER) After being defeated, Nero is seemingly sucked into his own black hole-like attack, leading Yuffie and Sonon to assume he's dead. However, the moment they turn their backs he reforms and attacks Yuffie with shadow tendrils, leading Sonon to sacrifice himself to save her.

[Fantastic Nuke](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasticNuke): In the third phase of the fight, he'll periodically use his Dark Matter skill, launching a large orb of darkness that will coat the entire floor in darkness, which will rapidly drain Yuffie and Sonon's health.
[Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss):  (SPOILER) Of the *Intergrade* DLC focusing on Yuffie.

[Finishing Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinishingMove): If Nero manages to get Yuffie or Sonon's health to critical, he will use his Soul Erosion skill to directly inflict a [Damage Over Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamageOverTime) effect and finish them off.

[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): Nero is incredibly fast and agile, and his ability to cause [Damage Over Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamageOverTime) with his darkness attacks allows him to rapidly inflict damage. But he is nowhere as resiliant as  (SPOILER) his brother Weiss in his boss fight  and can be pressured easily.
[Grapple Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrappleMove): His Binding Talons skill has his grab Yuffie or Sonon with his wings before kicking them into the air.

[Guns Akimbo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunsAkimbo): His weapons are twin pistols that he can wield with his [Razor Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RazorWings). He can also conjure guns made from darkness with his Salvo skill.

[Hellish Pupils](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellishPupils): Close-ups of his face reveal that he — like Sephiroth — has vertically-slitted pupils, likely as a result of the experimentation done to turn him into a SOLDIER.

[Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination): He looks human, but the experiments Shinra performed on him has given him strange and mysterious darkness-based abilites. Tellingly, when using the Assess skill on him, it will say "Unable to Read", which is only said on the Whisper Harbinger and Sephiroth, implying that he isn't just merely human anymore.

[Incest Subtext](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncestSubtext): His obsession with Weiss seems to go beyond brotherly love sometimes. While his comment about Shinra scientists not be able to replicate Weiss may sound like [Big Brother Worship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherWorship), he repeatedly makes some not-so-brotherly comments about his brother during his battle scene ("Oh, Weiss. This is it! This is it!" And "Oh, Weiss! I feel so alive").
    - He also calls Weiss his light at some point and say no one shall keep them apart.

[Institutional Apparel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstitutionalApparel): Nero is so [Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy) and dangerous that he's introduced bound in a straitjacket, with a Hannibal Lector-esque mask covering his head.
[Kick the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog): Slaughtering Deepground soldiers for no other reason than thinking it is fun.

[Knight of Cerebus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightOfCerebus): The introduction of Nero at the end of Intermission was the point where the episode took a major turn for [Darker and Edgier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkerAndEdgier), giving Yuffie and Sonon a hard battle and then basically tricked them into believing they won, only to pull the rug right out from under them and savor their despair.
[Laughing Mad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaughingMad): A lot. It makes him even creepier than his older brother.
