[Attack Drone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttackDrone): His Summon Sparks skill has it, well, summon sparks that will energize Ramuh, causing a [Holy Halo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HolyHalo) to from behind him. If the sparks aren't destroyed before the halo is complete, Ramuh will unleash Judgement Bolt and deal massive damage to the party.
[Barrier Warrior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarrierWarrior): His Lightning Rampart skill has it create a wall of lightning in front of him that will block attacks.
[Battle Boomerang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleBoomerang): His Orbiting Wand skill has him throw his staff around himself in a circle that spreads outwards.

[Bolt of Divine Retribution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoltOfDivineRetribution): His [Signature Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignatureMove), Judgement Bolt has it strike down foes with a massive bolt of lightning. His Lightning Strike skill is a smaller version of this trope.
[Downloadable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent): Ramuh is only unlockable as part of the *Intergrade* DLC.
[Energy Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnergyBall): His Thunderous Orbs skill has it fire lightning orbs that zigzag towards you.
[Energy Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnergyWeapon): His Circuitous Bolt skill has him firing beams of electricity that rotate around him in a wide radius.
[Epic Flail](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EpicFlail): Ramuh's Spark Flail has it create a medieval flail made of lightning and swing it at you.
[Ground Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GroundPunch): His Charged Current skill has it slam his staff to the ground, creating a large shockwave of electricity.

[Holy Halo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HolyHalo): When summoned, a halo will slowly form behind him, and when completed, he'll cast Judgment Bolt. In his VR boss fight, he'll summon sparks that will energize Ramuh, causing a [Holy Halo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HolyHalo) to from behind him. If the sparks aren't destroyed before the halo is complete, Ramuh will unleash Judgement Bolt and deal massive damage to the party.

[Javelin Thrower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JavelinThrower): His Voltaic Lance skill has it call down a lance of lightning that will linger on the battlefield, stunning any enemy that wanders too close.
[Magic Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicStaff): As always, Ramuh goes to battle armed with a staff to channel and manipulate lighting.
[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): Ramuh's title as the "Lord of Levin" is taken from his moniker in *[Final Fantasy XIV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIV)*.
[Old Save Bonus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OldSaveBonus): He can be obtained in *Rebirth* by having save data from *Episode  INTERmission *.
[The Paralyzer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParalyzer): Some of Ramuh's attacks in his boss fight can stun your characters.
[Purple Is Powerful](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PurpleIsPowerful): His lightning is purple and he is a powerful lightning deity.

[Rain of Arrows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RainOfArrows): His Levin Arrows skill has it rain down lightning arrows that linger on the battlefield, acting as obstacles that will stun you if you wander too close.
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): As befitting his title, Ramuh primarily attacks using bolts of lightning and beams of electricity.
[Spell Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBlade): Ramuh's Luminous Falchion skill has it wreathing his staff in a blade of electricity and wielding it like a sword.
[Wizard Beard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WizardBeard): A powerful lightning deity with an absolutely massive beard.
[Wizard Classic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WizardClassic): Ramuh resembles an old man with a long white beard, wielding an ornate magical staff and wearing an ornate robe.
[Yellow Lightning, Blue Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YellowLightningBlueLightning): He wields purple lightning.
[Bare-Fisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk): Outside of his [Dishing Out Dirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt) magic, he attacks using his bare fists and legs.

[Boulder Bludgeon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoulderBludgeon): Fittingly for an earth elemental summon, he can create huge boulders and hurl them at his enemies as a ranged attack. Stone will have him throw one rock projectile while Stonega will have him throw one at the entire party. His unique move "Boulder Hurl" has him lift several stones from the floor before combining them into a huge boulder and hurling it as a projectile.

[Charged Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChargedAttack): His "[Granite Shell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContainmentField)" will have him assume a crouching position and start charging up for several seconds before he attacks, giving the party the charge to interrupt it before he can finish charging.
[Containment Field](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContainmentField): His move "Granite Shell" has him summon rocks to entomb one of your party members, so he can charge in and smash them for huge damage.

[Dishing Out Dirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt): [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope) since *Rebirth* doesn't have Earth as an elemental type. So while he can manipulate the Earth in his attacks, he deals [Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental) damage.
[Earthy Barefoot Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarthyBarefootCharacter): Has large, but human-shaped bare feet, to go along with his earth motif.

[Food God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoodGod): Chadley claims it was worshiped as a harvest god in the past, and Kalm's current harvest festivals are based on the food tributes farmers offered to Titan in the past.
[Fangs Are Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FangsAreEvil): Has two large fangs on his lower jaw, as a sign of his otherworldness.

[Grapple Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrappleMove): "Sling" is a [unblockable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnblockableAttack) move where he'll grab a party member, shake them around (for a period where other characters can stagger Titan to free the grabbed party), and then throw them away for considerable damage.
[Physical God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGod): He was worshiped as a creator deity throughout the Grasslands, and shrines devoted to him can be found throughout the region.
[Shockwave Stomp](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockwaveStomp): His stomp attacks has a  AoE  shockwave effect.
[Tiny-Headed Behemoth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TinyHeadedBehemoth): Has a large body and a disproportionately smaller head.

[The Maker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMaker): According to a legend of the Junon region, in return for a kind angler sharing his fire with it, the Phoenix brought forth the multitude of fishes that populate the oceans.

[The Phoenix](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePhoenix): It is a legendary firebird with [Born-Again Immortality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BornAgainImmortality)—its special attack being to burn to ashes in a massive firestorm before rising from the flames anew.

[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): As its name suggests, Phoenix has fire-based attacks superior to even those of Ifrit—just one of its feathers falling to the ground conjures a massive firestorm. However, its flames are said to imbue those they touch with renewed life.

[The Power of Creation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePowerOfCreation): Phoenix's flames can create life just as easily as they can burn them away. During the fight Phoenix will periodically create mooks to help it fight and after using Phoenix Flame an entire set of allies shows up with it.
[Humongous Mecha](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumongousMecha): Alexander is an ancient mech that is worshipped as a god in the Corel region.

[Deity of Mortal Creation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeityOfMortalCreation): He's a mech used by an ancient civilization to smite their enemies, but in the present day he's worshipped as a god of judgement whose proclamations are absolute and cannot be defied. And he's used by parents to [frighten unruly children into obedience](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScareEmStraight).
[Light 'em Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightEmUp): He can fire bolts, blasts and pillars of holy light from its arm-cannons and power core.

[Sweeping Laser Explosion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SweepingLaserExplosion): Its Judgement attack has it fire a beam of Holy energy from its head that trails an explosion so powerful that it creates a mushroom cloud.
[Weapon of Mass Destruction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeaponOfMassDestruction): According to Chadley, Alexander annihilated a "great but wicked nation" that inhabited the Corel region overnight.
[Brutish Bulls](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutishBulls): Kujata resembles a monstrous bull with six sets of horns—one for each of its three snouts.
[Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning): Kujata has command over fire, ice, and lightning—signified by its mane changing colors between red, blue, and yellow.

[Many-Faced Divinity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManyFacedDivinity): Kujata is a bull-like beast-god with six eyes and three noses layered on top of each other, with six increasingly large sets of horns.
[Adaptation Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationNameChange): It was called Neo Bahamut in the original *Final Fantasy VII* ' s English localization.
[Backpack Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackpackCannon): It has a pair of biomechanical plasma cannons mounted on its back that double as rocket boosters.
[Blade Below the Shoulder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeBelowTheShoulder): It has a pair of biomechanical swords attached to its back that it can attach to its arms to give itself arm-blades.

[Breath Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreathWeapon): Its Flame Breath attack shoots purple flames from its jaws, its Laser Raze attack fires a narrow energy beam that trails explosions, and its Gigaflare fires a massive energy beam from its jaws.

[Came Back Strong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameBackStrong): While Avalanche investigates the Divine Intel of Cosmo Canyon, Chadley comments that according to legend Bahamut was nearly killed during a fierce battle and sought refuge in Cosmo Canyon, where it was not only able to recover but ascended into Bahamut Arisen in the process.

[Degraded Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DegradedBoss): A relative example:  (SPOILER) During the final battle sequence with Sephiroth Arisen, one phase has him summon a duplicate of Bahamut Arisen. This Bahamut is a fair amount weaker than the one you fight for his summon materia (particularly the full power Bahamut), but still can be dangerous. However, his health pool is low enough that you can take him down relatively fast. This is due to the fact that Sephiroth will simply revive him after a short period, as the *real* boss is Sephiroth's wings that heal Bahamut.
[Destroyer Deity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DestroyerDeity): It's called a god of destruction, and lives up to the name with its plethora of powerful attacks.
[Dragons Are Divine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonsAreDivine): Like the original Bahamut, it is an ancient draconic deity worshiped as a god of destruction.

[Magic Missile Storm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicMissileStorm): Its Homing Shot attack and the leadup to its Gigaflare attack fire multiple volleys of purple energy projectiles from its wingtips that home in on an opponent.

[Metamorphosis Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MetamorphosisMonster): It's said to be the result of Bahamut undergoing a metamorphosis into an even more powerful and destructive form, and Chadley suspects that Arisen isn't even Bahamut's final form—a reference to Bahamut Zero.

[Spin Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpinAttack): Its Soaring Slash and Whirlwind Slash attacks have it twirl in midair—vertically and horizontally respectively—while slicing opponents with its arm-blades.
[Spell Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBlade): When it enters Gigadrive Mode, it wreathes its arm-blades in crimson energy.
[Sweeping Laser Explosion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SweepingLaserExplosion): Its Laser Raze attack has it fire an energy beam from its mouth that trails explosions in its wake a few seconds later.

[Wave-Motion Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionGun): Its Gigaflare attack has it fire three massive beams of destructive energy from its shoulder-cannons and maw before spitting an even more powerful beam that scours a furrow into the ground.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): Odin wields the massive sword Zantetsuken with one hand, using it to effortlessly cleave through his opponents.

[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): His love of battle is a fight mechanic — using ATB skills, evading his attacks, and inflicting status ailments on him, will pressure Odin while simultaneously "thrilling" him. Fighting too passively disheartens him and eventually he'll use Zantetsuken to end the fight instantly.
[Cool Horse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolHorse): Odin, like his namesake from Norse mythology, rides the eight-legged horse Sleipnir.

[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): Odin is armed with the greatsword Zantetsuken and the divine spear Gungnir, and in the third phase of his boss fight wields both at the same time.
[Jousting Lance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JoustingLance): He uses Gungnir as both a melee weapon and to hurl at opponents for ranged attacks.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): As he uses Zantetsuken, lightning strikes and illuminates his sword, alluding to Odin's appearance in other games where he's either [associated with lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe) or is said to have been beaten when lightning struck his sword.
[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): Zantetsuken instantly  KOs  the whole party by doing 9999 damage.
[Turns Red](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TurnsRed): When the fight has worn on long enough, he'll swap out Gungnir for Zantetsuken, showing he's gotten more serious.

[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent): Using ATB skills on him to show your strength will please him, but if you go too long without doing so, he'll consider you too weak and use Zantetsuken to end the fight then and there.
[The Dividual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDividual): They're a trio but act as a single individual.
[Downloadable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent): The Moogle Trio is only available as pre-order DLC.
[Kamehame Hadoken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KamehameHadoken): Their ultimate move is "Kupovalse", where all three fire a magical beam toward one enemy.
[Downloadable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent): Magic Pot is only available for the Digital Deluxe Edition of *Rebirth*.
[Healing Potion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingPotion): Its Ultimate move "Magic Elixir" is to use a healing elixir on the party, restoring them to full health.
[Random Effect Spell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RandomEffectSpell): Will grant a random buff to a party once summoned.
[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): She's a sweet, adorable little girl who's adored by just about everybody who meets her.
[Daddy's Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DaddysGirl): She listens to what Barret tells her, like being wary of strangers, and adores him just as much as he does for her.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): Barret isn't her biological father, but she loves him like her dad.
[Locked Out of the Loop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LockedOutOfTheLoop): She is oblivious to the existence of Avalanche, believing that Barret hands out flyers as a member of the neighborhood watch.
[Pink Means Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinkMeansFeminine): She wears a short pink dress.

[Touched by Vorlons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TouchedByVorlons): She seems to gain some sort of  (SPOILER) greater understanding of what is happening, like Red XIII, after touching Aerith when the Sector 7 plate is about to fall. Unlike Red XIII, what she knows or learns isn't explored in *Remake*, only being touched on a few times afterward, such as when she is about to say something to Elmyra and possibly at the end of Remake when she knows that Barret is calling out to her . In *Rebirth*, it's revealed that—unlike Red XIII and Aerith, she retains  (SPOILER) knowledge of the future, which she passes on to Zack by warning him that Aerith is destined to be killed by Sephiroth .
[Troubled Fetal Position](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TroubledFetalPosition): She looks like this when she's hiding in Seventh Heaven during the fall of the plate.
[When You Coming Home, Dad?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenYouComingHomeDad): She frequently waits up for her father to come back home, and expresses disappointment when he's unable to do so.

[Wise Beyond Their Years](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WiseBeyondTheirYears): She understands the reasons Barret gives her when he tells her why he has to leave, and even Barret comments that Marlene is tougher than he is.

[Adaptational Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalNameChange): Somewhat debatable, but her original concept artwork notes her surname as Strauss. The remake changes it to Strife to match her son.

[Dies Differently in Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiesDifferentlyInAdaptation): In the original game, she was one of the many casualties from Sephiroth's burning of Nibelheim. In the Remake, Sephiroth claims to have murdered her personally with the Masamune.
[Family Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyThemeNaming): She and her son's names sound pretty similar to one another.

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): She's shown to be a caring and supportive mother to Cloud.  (SPOILER)  It's implied by her dialogue in *Rebirth* that she was very comforting to Cloud when she found out he didn't make it into SOLDIER.

[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): *Final Fantasy VII Remake* marks the first time Claudia's name is actually given in an official piece of *Final Fantasy VII* media. Previously, [her name could only be found scribbled underneath her concept artwork for the original game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual).

[Open-Minded Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OpenMindedParent): Cloud remembers that when he decided to leave Nibelheim to try to become a SOLDIER at the age of thirteen, his mother didn't protest and wanted to give him two thousand gil so he could have a "fresh start", which he refused as he felt he wouldn't need it when he enlisted. Barret notes that Cloud's habit of charging two thousand for his services is probably a consequence of this.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She was killed by Sephiroth five years before the events of the game's story, and only shows up in [flashbacks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flashback).
[So Proud of You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoProudOfYou): In a flashback, she says she is proud of the man Cloud has become.

[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): Her son strongly takes after her. In fact, a flashback shows that he could pass as her twin, strange natural hair shape and all. While cross-dressing in Wall Market, Cloud could almost pass as a younger version of Claudia.
[Struggling Single Mother](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrugglingSingleMother): Cloud's father died when he was young, forcing Claudia to raise and support Cloud all by herself.
[All There in the Manual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual): He's only named in the *Remake Ultimania*.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): Died five years ago in the Nibelheim Incident, having been cut down by Sephiroth.

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): Tifa remembers him fondly despite how overprotective he could be. *Trace of Two Pasts* shows he was very supportive of Tifa, and even personally helped with her martial arts training when Zangan was away.

[Open-Minded Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OpenMindedParent): Brian Lockhart is portrayed as being very open-minded when raising Tifa in *Trace of Two Pasts*, especially for a conservative little village like Nibelheim. He not only allows Tifa to become Zangan's pupil with little prodding but actually dedicates himself to helping her train once he sees how devoted she is to it.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): Dead since well before the game starts. He's shown only in [flashbacks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flashback) in *Rebirth*, but his death is part of the reason why Tifa joined Avalanche in the first place.

[Adaptational Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalJerkass): Downplayed. In the remake, she's more firm about her request that Cloud stay away from Aerith and never speak to her again, with her tone of voice expressing that she doesn't want him around her. In the original, she's a bit gentler when she asks Cloud to leave during the night without telling Aerith.

[Anger Born of Worry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngerBornOfWorry): She acts dismissive and callous towards Cloud upon meeting him, largely out of fear that he's putting her daughter in danger by acting as her bodyguard.

["Friends" Rent Control](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendsRentControl): Like in the original, she's somehow able to afford a multi-story house with a massive flower garden, when most of the slum dwellers live in a shantytown. The novel *[Trace of Two Pasts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/FinalFantasyVIIRemakeTraceOfTwoPasts)* reveals that she married into a family whose primary business was development contracting, with a bit of unsavory mafia-like behavior on the side.

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): Despite not being related to Aerith by blood, she treats her as her own daughter and loves her dearly. She even offers to look after Marlene later in the game after the destruction of Sector 7.

[I Will Wait for You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWillWaitForYou): When her husband stopped returning home, she waited for his arrival everyday at the train station, until she was told that he had been killed in action.

[Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear): A non-violent example; she's very protective of Aerith, to the point of asking Cloud to leave her home and never speak to Aerith again when she realizes that he's a  SOLDIER .
[Muggle Foster Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MuggleFosterParents): She is a normal woman who ended up adopting Aerith, the last Cetra in the world.
[Last of Her Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHerKind): She was the last pure-blooded Cetra in the world.
[Not Enough to Bury](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotEnoughToBury):  (SPOILER) Hojo reveals to Aerith that he's dissected her mother's corpse, leaving only organs, bones and tissue to study.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only given a first name, and her surname is never given.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She died when Aerith was five, and her final act was entrusting her to Elmyra.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): Hojo notes that her grown-up daughter is her spitting image.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She was one of the victims during Shinra's purge of Corel. She only shows up in visions of the past, but Barret does mention her on occasion.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): Episode  InterMISSION  has Yuffie and Sonon mention he's now under house arrest, but doesn't make clear why. The implication is that he suffered a coup d'etat by whoever is leading the "New Wutai Goverment". *Rebirth* confirms that he was indeed removed from power due to a coup d'état led by Glenn Lodbrok.
[The Ghost](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGhost): He doesn't show up in Episode  InterMISSION , but is a recurring topic between Yuffie and Sonon since he's Sonon's mentor and Yuffie's father.
[Mentor Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorArchetype): Sonon and Melphie were both his ninja apprentices, and Sonon in particular still respects him a great deal.

[Pacifism Backfire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PacifismBackfire): According to Yuffie, the reason he was deposed was because the people of Wutai were outraged that he had agreed to a ceasefire with Shinra after all the death and destruction they had suffered, which ironically led them to support Glenn, a warmongering ex-Soldier, who incites a new war against the company  (SPOILER) because it is in the interests of Sephiroth, his master .

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): Nero retrieves  (SPOILER) his body after (seemingly) killing him, so although he might be dead, it remains up in the air what Nero has in store for him .

[Animal Battle Aura](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalBattleAura): He can create a serpentine [water dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash) around his staff as one of his techniques, with Leviathan being the patron deity of his homeland of Wutai this is entirely appropriate.

[Beleaguered Assistant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeleagueredAssistant): [Downplayed.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope) There are instances where he openly expresses annoyance towards Yuffie's antics, but they are A: relatively minor and kept to himself, B: offset by the fact that he otherwise has nothing but respect for her, and C: completely understandable considering what he [constantly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam) [has to](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallNameBigEgo) [put up with](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighlyVisibleNinja).

[Big Brother Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherInstinct): He becomes protective of Yuffie soon after their introduction, often going out of his way to shield her from harm and reining in her more reckless antics.
[Canon Foreigner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonForeigner): The first party member to be a completely new one created for the remake.
[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): He has a few  NPCs  in Sector 7 pining for him due to his good looks and brooding aura.
[Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack): He can enter a Synergized mode with Yuffie, changing all of her attacks into team attacks with himself.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): He has his moments, often in response to Yuffie's silly antics.
QUOTE **Yuffie**: What's a good word to describe me? I'm thinking "legendary."<br data-format="\\"/>**Sonon**: I'm thinking "modest."
[Downloadable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownloadableContent): He is only playable if Yuffie's episode is purchased.

[Draw Aggro](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrawAggro): His "Incite" weapon skill can draw the aggression of enemies towards him and away from Yuffie, though it will wear off after Yuffie deals a certain amount of damage to the affected enemy.
[Face Palm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacePalm): He tends to react this way to Yuffie's more over-the-top actions.
[Fastball Special](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FastballSpecial): The Ninja Cannonball command will launch Yuffie at enemies with his staff.

[Gameplay and Story Integration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration): Doubles as a [Foreshadowing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing). If Yuffie  (SPOILER) goes down in battle, Sonon will use "Self Sacrifice" to transfer his current health and ATB charge to his fallen comrade. Ultimately, Sonon gives his life protecting Yuffie following their battle with Nero .
[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): You can't control Sonon in Yuffie's episode, but you can give him commands like a full party member.

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): Sonon saves Yuffie from  (SPOILER) Nero's attack out of brotherly instinct, not wanting to make the same mistake like he did with Melphie. This valiant act, however, costs him his own life .
[Highly-Visible Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighlyVisibleNinja): While not necessarily recognizable as a ninja, his armor pieces do make him immediately recognizable as someone from Wutai.
[It's Personal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsPersonal): Sonon has a personal vendetta against Scarlet,  (SPOILER) due to one of her mechs going out of control and killing his sister .
[Kung-Fu Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KungFuWizard): Sonon is skilled at both martial arts and ninjutsu, and when synergized with Yuffie will mimic her ninjutsu when she does ranged attacks.

[Making a Splash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash): For his [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), Dance of the Dragon, Sonon will conjure a water dragon for the final blow. But it's purely aesthetic since the game has no water elemental damage.

[Martial Arts Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MartialArtsStaff): Like Aerith, he uses a staff, although his is more of a martial artist's weapon than a spellcasting stick. It appears to be a hybrid of Cid's polearms and Aerith's staffs; he wields it like a classical quarterstaff or bo.
[Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ninja): He's one of the elite ninjas of Wutai who was apprenticed to Yuffie's father, the former leader of Wutai.

[Older Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderSidekick): Sonon is the elder in his partnership with Yuffie but he still defers to her as both his master's daughter and ninja superior since she has been in training longer than he has.
[Practical Taunt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PracticalTaunt): He can use the Incite ability which will cause enemies to target him rather than Yuffie.

[Roaring Rampage of Revenge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoaringRampageOfRevenge): Sonon's sister, Melphie, was  (SPOILER) killed by one of Scarlet's mechs. Because of this, he joins AVALANCHE to avenge her and has a very hard time keeping his cool in Scarlet's presence .

[Sacrificial Lion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacrificialLion): He fits that role. After a charming couple of hours of introduction where he is presented as a fellow member of the Wutai army along with Yuffie, proving to be a reliable and skillful ally while serving as the secondary focus character of this sidestory, he ends up  (SPOILER) being killed protecting her from an attack by Nero .

[Sacrificial Revival Spell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacrificialRevivalSpell): If you manage to get Yuffie knocked out in battle, Sonon will automatically use Final Sacrifice to revive and give all his remaining HP to her at the cost of knocking himself out.

[Savvy Guy, Energetic Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavvyGuyEnergeticGirl): Although Sonon allows Yuffie to lead them and even refers to her as "Boss", it is clear that he is tempered and far less impulsive than she is.

[Spin Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpinAttack): Twirling Lunge is his default ability, where he does a spinning attack with his [Martial Arts Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MartialArtsStaff), which is effective at increasing an enemy's stagger gauge.

[Unknown Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnknownRival): He has a personal grudge against Scarlet due to the fact  (SPOILER)  one of her war machines killed his sister Melphie. But Scarlet has no idea who he and his sister are and couldn't care less, seeing him as just a random ninja of Wutai.

[You Killed My Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouKilledMyFather): Or in this case,  (SPOILER) "You killed my sister". Sonon's little sister, Melphie, was killed by one of Scarlet's machines gone haywire, causing him to have a personal grudge against her .
[Younger Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoungerThanTheyLook): Despite appearing old enough to frequent the red light district, he is identified as a teenager by Scarlet.
[Actor Allusion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActorAllusion): Not the first time his English voice actor calls a sword-wielding badass protagonist ["Bro"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/TengenToppaGurrenLagann)

[Adaptational Dumbass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalDumbass): While he was never a smart guy *per se*, Johnny didn't land himself into any trouble in the original game, and got by just fine without any help from Cloud and company. In *Remake*, his loose lips get him arrested and nearly killed by Shinra troopers and Cloud respectively, and he goes through all sorts of hilarious hijinks in Wall Market due to attempting one ill-conceived plan after another.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): In the original game, he was just a minor recurring  NPC  you could talk to in Sector 7, Wall Market, and Costa del Sol. Here, he's a lot more involved due to the [Adaptation Expansion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationExpansion) the game provides, especially during the Wall Market chapter which he accompanies Cloud for a good chunk of.

[Born Unlucky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BornUnlucky): Johnny suffers from humiliation after humiliation, with his only strokes of good luck being Tifa stopping Cloud from executing him and that Cloud is begrudgingly willing to help him. This status eases up for him in *Rebirth*, where after some more tribulations, he finally gets a lucky break and finds real success running his own business.

[Butt-Monkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButtMonkey): Johnny is routinely humiliated by just about every situation he finds himself in, but only loses heart when  (SPOILER) he gets his butt kicked in the Corneo Colosseum .
[Dogged Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoggedNiceGuy): He's a decent guy and head over heels for Tifa, even proclaiming that she's his girlfriend. She can only sigh in exasperation.

[The Exile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheExile): Invoked when Cloud – who was about to behead Johnny for outing Jessie as a member of Avalanche to Shinra – tells Johnny to leave Midgar and never return, on pain of death, which Johnny panicky acquiesces. Tifa later implies she found him again on her own and convince him it was for the best for him leave Midgar since Shinra now had him in their sights. Johnny, however never gets around to leaving Midgar until near the end of the game, when he decides to leave Midgar for good after Cloud helps him retrieve the money stolen by Kyrie. He's later encountered of running a hotel in Costa del Sol in *Rebirth*.

[Failed a Spot Check](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FailedASpotCheck): Johnny is blissfully unaware that the man who threatened to kill him unless he left Midgar immediately is the same person he calls his "bro". Justified because A) he was blindfolded, and B) Johnny's got what you might call a severe deficiency in the "listening" department.
[Fiery Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FieryRedhead): Has bright reddish hair and a short temper to match.
[Hero-Worshipper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroWorshipper): Towards Cloud after he aces his way through the Colosseum battles. Johnny begins to sing his praises from then on.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Even though it takes seven of him, in *Rebirth* Johnny manages to renovate a building that was about to fall apart at the seams into a hotel that's not only functional, but outright classy, all without asking Cloud for anything but raw materials.

[Hollywood Healing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HollywoodHealing): When you find him in the Colosseum, you'll see he's barely able to sit upright and is covered in bruises and bandages from the thorough thrashing he got fighting. The next time you run into him, Johnny will be perfectly fine, even though only a few hours could have passed at most.
[Hopeless Suitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessSuitor): He is in love with Tifa and utterly convinced she is his girlfriend, to her exasperation.

[Horrible Judge of Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HorribleJudgeOfCharacter): Played for laughs.
    - Johnny never seems to pick up that his "Bro", Cloud, finds him *annoying as hell*. - He thinks that the mayor of Costa Del Sol did him a massive favor by loaning him the money to buy an inn (a dilapidated one in sore need of renovations). Except it's clearly just a trick by the mayor to keep Johnny deep in debt and under his thumb as a lackey.
[It Runs in the Family](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItRunsInTheFamily): Johnny's father can be encountered in Wall Market, and appears to be about as good a judge of character as his son.
[Keet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Keet): Johnny is a cheerful, exuberant, and generally kind person, but he's so high-energy that he can frequently end up being... a bit much.
[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): His near-constantly loud, bombastic personality, and over-the-top mannerisms are hard to ignore.

[The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad): He unintentionally makes every situation he gets into worse, starting with him outing Jessie as a member of Avalanche to a pair of Shinra guards. As a result, nobody really likes Johnny all that much, generally treating him with a mix of pity, condescension, and exasperation. Despite this, he seems to be under the impression that he and Cloud are best friends — calling him "Bro" despite Cloud repeatedly telling him not to do so — and that Tifa is his girlfriend.

[Loose Lips](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LooseLips): Johnny rats Jessie out to some Shinra guards who are "[interrogating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TortureAlwaysWorks)" him, causing Cloud to go from trying to rescue him to trying to kill him.

[Me's a Crowd](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MesACrowd): In *Rebirth*, Yuffie creates several clones of him to help deal with an ongoing boss fight, and the clones inexplicably stick around afterward, helping Johnny Prime renovate his hotel in a lengthy sidequest.
[Motor Mouth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MotorMouth): Along with his loose lips, he never knows when to stop talking.
[Oblivious to Hatred](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToHatred): He seems wilfully oblivious to the fact that Cloud can't stand him.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[The Pollyanna](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePollyanna): One of Johnny's more redeeming aspects. No matter how bad things get, no matter how many times he gets knocked on his ass, Johnny always picks himself up and stays optimistic.

[Put on a Bus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PutOnABus): Literally in *Remake*. Johnny's last appearance in *Remake* is him making good on his promise to skip town... but only AFTER ([and if](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Sidequest)) you help him recover his stolen wallet. Also counts as [Shoo Out the Clowns](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShooOutTheClowns). Downplayed in "Rebirth" when Cloud's group meets him again in Costa de Sol.

[Throw the Dog a Bone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowTheDogABone): In *Rebirth*, he gets hailed as a hero for his part in defeating the Grasptropod, causing the people of Costa del Sol to convince the mayor to cancel his debts. Then, with the help of his clones and the party, he fixes his hotel.
[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): Always wears an open jacket that exposes his front torso.

[Adaptational Heroism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalHeroism): Compared to their original incarnations, who seem to have been rather indifferent about the mass destruction their bombings caused, as despite the implied civilian deaths caused by the bomb, they treat the explosion as a victory, and are [implied](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpliedTrope) to not be in it for purely altruistic reasons, they're treated here as being collectively more humane. As opposed to their actions in the original, they originally intended to merely sabotage the reactor and are horrified by the destruction their bomb caused, unaware that it was actually Shinra making the damage much worse to paint them in a bad light. As a result, one Chapter has Cloud assist Jessie, Biggs and Wedge in stealing parts from a Shinra Warehouse to make a more stable bomb so they won't have a repeat.

[The Alliance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAlliance): Barret’s group is allied with many other versions of Avalanche around the world, with different methods but the same goal of saving the planet. The much more militant and violent Avalanche from *Before Crisis* is established in *Intergrade* to have fallen out of power, with the new main branch of Avalanche now ironically considering Barret's cell to be excessively violent and extremist.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Biggs, Wedge and Jessie barely appear in the original game, but receive substantially more screentime than they ever had before - the trio have more dialogue in the opening hours of the remake than they did in the entirety of the original game.
[Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker): They are all skilled enough on motorcycles to fight off Shinra's motorcycle mounted  MPs .

[Bomb-Throwing Anarchists](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BombThrowingAnarchists): Shinra paints them as such, calling them allies of [Wutai](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Wutai) that are destabilizing Midgar's economy and causing rampant destruction.
[Eco-Terrorist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EcoTerrorist): They destroy mako reactors to save the planet from being ruthlessly exploited by Shinra.
[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): The three of them aid Cloud in the first motorcycle battle.
[Mage Marksman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MageMarksman): They are all equipped with a firearm and different materia.

[Neighbourhood-Friendly Gangsters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeighbourhoodFriendlyGangsters): They're ecoterrorists on paper, but they run the neighborhood watch to keep Sector 7 safe from monsters (and presumably human threats as well), and even [basic community maintenance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoringButPractical) like supplying the locals with water filters or supplies for Sector 5's orphanages.

tropeName: The Revolution Will Not Be Civilized
tropeNotes: [The Revolution Will Not Be Civilized](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRevolutionWillNotBeCivilized): A substantial portion of the new content in *Remake* centers around the factional politics between Avalanche's different cells, with Barret's faction falling into a middle ground between the nonviolent Avalanche HQ and the outright [Kill All Humans](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillAllHumans) stance of the iteration from *Before Crisis*. Wutai's enhanced presence in the story further complicates matters.

[True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions): Unlike the original story where they only seem tangentially hired by Barret, these three know each other well enough to snark at their little problems, praise their good sides and teach Cloud about one another.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom): It's ambiguous as to whether  (SPOILER) Biggs is the only member of the trio to be [Spared by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SparedByTheAdaptation) or if Jessie survived as well .

[Affectionate Gesture to the Head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffectionateGestureToTheHead):  (SPOILER) One of the last things he does in your final conversation with him is put his hand on Cloud's head. Given that he, during this conversation, implies that he can see through Cloud's act, noting that he's very similar to the orphans of the Leaf House, it's an obvious attempt at comforting the traumatized child that Biggs can see under the facade.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): By the end of  (SPOILER) *Rebirth*, it's unclear whether Biggs survived in the "prime" universe, or if his survival was only in an offshoot reality .

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Barely a character in the original game. Biggs has a substantially larger role in the remake with an expanded backstory and a far more complex personality.

[Crazy-Prepared](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrazyPrepared): He has multiple contingency plans formed in case a mission goes south. When Cloud, Barret and Tifa are forced to evacuate their train during the Sector 5 mission, they tell Cloud it's time for Biggs' "plan E" back-up.

[Cynic–Idealist Duo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CynicIdealistDuo): The Cynic to Wedge's Idealist. Compared to the rather optimistic Wedge, the reason he's [Crazy-Prepared](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrazyPrepared) is because he tends to overanalyze things and can spend all night worrying about what could possibly go wrong. Right before the Reactor 5 mission, even Cloud tells him to take it easy.

[Dies Differently In The Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiesDifferentlyInTheAdaptation): An example that gets a bit confusing. In the original, he  (SPOILER) dies protecting the Sector 7 plate. However, at the end of *Remake*, it's shown that he's still alive. *Rebirth* however brings some ambiguity in, as he's only seen alive in an offshoot reality of the "main" reality, and then other offshoots of *that* reality are shown depending on whether Zack chose to try to meet Hojo or stop Biggs from performing a suicide bombing (discernible by what breed Stamp appears to be whenever he appears). In the reality where Zack chooses to stop Biggs, Biggs is shot to death by Shinra soldiers, but there is ambiguity about whether he is still alive or not in the "prime" reality .

[Foreshadowing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing): Part of Biggs's backstory is only revealed through incidental dialogue and a side quest that, to the point of [The Reveal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReveal), has nothing to do with him. In your final conversation with him he also implies that  (SPOILER) his experience with taking care of orphans makes him able to see through Cloud's tough-guy act, but that's something we won't explore until *way* further down the line.
[Hand Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandCannon): Biggs' weapon of choice is a large-caliber handgun.

[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): As befits their names, Biggs and Wedge are practically married. Although Jessie makes this a trio, the two guys are particularly close.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): He heads up Sector 7's town watch in his spare time,  (SPOILER) and used to run the Leaf House school in Sector 5 . He also stops Wedge tagging along with Cloud and Tifa as the former is shown around Sector 7, reasoning that they haven’t seen each other in five years.
[The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer): To Barret, as he's the one in charge of operations when Barret's not around.

[Neat Freak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeatFreak): He's neat and tidy by nature. After the first reactor mission, he's disgusted by his own smell and makes [several comments about longing for a hot shower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BathingBeauty).

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): Bears a striking resemblance to Chris Taylor, played by [Charlie Sheen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/CharlieSheen) in the movie *[Platoon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Platoon)*. He even jokes that he has a platoon in him when Cloud asks how he is. His English VA [Gideon Emery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/GideonEmery) seems to be doing a deliberate Charlie Sheen vocal impression as well.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given. Given he's an orphan from the slums, he likely never had one.

[Playful Hacker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayfulHacker): He's very carefree when he's hacking the doors for the Mako Reactor.
QUOTE **Biggs:** *[doing a dramatic gesture]* Bada-bing bada-boom bam!

[Spared by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SparedByTheAdaptation):  (SPOILER) He survives Shinra's attack on the plate, because Cloud and company rewrote the timeline. One of the shots just before the credits shows Biggs bandaged up in the Leaf House, heavily injured but alive, slowly opening his eyes. He shows up again in a trailer for *Rebirth* for a reason: during the Sector 7 attack, Biggs was transported from the beagle Stamp timeline by the Whipsers to the same terrier Stamp timeline where Zack survived after Cloud and the others defeated the Arbiter of Fate.
[The Strategist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStrategist): Of Barret's cell, as he's the one that comes up with plans that the others execute.
[Acrofatic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Acrofatic): While he may be overweight, he's more-than-capable of keeping up with the more-outwardly athletic Biggs and Jessie.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Barely a character in the original game. Wedge has a substantially larger role in the remake, with a far more complex personality.  (SPOILER) Wedge also lives much longer and saves most of the Sector 7 civilians from the plate. The Whispers are *furious* with him for it, and so push him out the window towards [Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom). *Rebirth* confirms that Wedge did not survive the fall.
[BFG](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFG): Wedge's weapon is a giant shotgun of some sort.
[Big Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEater): Starts complaining about his hunger when he gets nervous.

[Big Fun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFun): He's overweight, but extremely jovial and friendly. He has the most optimistic attitude of the members of Avalanche, is a [Kindhearted Cat Lover](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KindheartedCatLover), and generally tries to save people when the situation calls for it.

[Butt-Monkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButtMonkey): He's the subject of several comical scenes, like getting his butt chomped on by a Guard Dog while acting as a distraction, having Biggs pull his pants down to take a look in the following scene, and Jessie slap his exposed butt while teasing him.
[Character Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterTic): As seen on the right; giving people a thumbs up.

[Cynic–Idealist Duo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CynicIdealistDuo): The Idealist to Biggs' Cynic. Compared to the more calculated Biggs, Wedge has a more positive outlook on things and doesn't worry as much about the outcome of his actions, eager to put himself in harm's way to help his friends. Although this might also have to do with [how he perceives himself](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad).

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): Becomes this after surviving the fall from the Sector 7 plate pillar and a [You Are Better Than You Think You Are](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreBetterThanYouThinkYouAre) talk from Aerith. He gets the Shinra guards that told him to buzz off to open the gate to evacuate Sector 7, survives the plate falling on him and sending him crashing through an underground lab, infiltrates Shinra HQ while heavily injured, even though just getting to the HQ gave Cloud, Tifa, and Barret trouble.  (SPOILER) When the Arbiters of Fate opt to not leave Wedge's fate to chance anymore, they try throwing him out of the Shinra building, but he struggles and tries to claw his way through them. 
QUOTE  **Wedge:** *[to the Arbiters]* You can't stop me!

[Dies Differently In The Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiesDifferentlyInTheAdaptation):  (SPOILER)  While he avoids his original fate and survives the plate drop, he does not survive the fall from the Shinra building.
[Fat Comic Relief](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatComicRelief): There are a lot of jokes based on his weight and [Big Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEater) habits.

[Gory Discretion Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoryDiscretionShot):  (SPOILER)  Nayo, Billy Bob and Polk witness Wedge fall from the Shinra building during a flashback in Rebirth and the camera changes to their dazed expressions when Wedge hits the ground.

[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): As befits their names, Biggs and Wedge are practically married. Although Jessie makes this a trio, the two guys are particularly close.

[Kindhearted Cat Lover](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KindheartedCatLover): Wedge adores cats — having three of them as pets, and is the gentlest and most optimistic member of Avalanche — even though he has self-esteem issues.

[King of Games](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingOfGames): He seems very skilled at various types of games, having the highest score at the Seventh Heaven dart game and being an ace Fort Condor player who's only behind the grandmaster in ranking.

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): The nicest of the Avalanche trio. While Biggs and Jessie are good and affable people who have to be pragmatic, Wedge takes the cake for being the most sincere and kindhearted individual among them. His friendly attitude ends up being a major reason Cloud changes his mind on the group and helps them out later.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given. Given he's an orphan from the slums, he likely never had one.

[Pain to the Ass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PainToTheAss): His butt gets chomped on by a Shinra guard dog when he offers himself up as a distraction during Jessie's Shinra warehouse theft. She quips that it's barely singed.

[Spanner in the Works](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpannerInTheWorks):  (SPOILER) Wedge surviving his fall from the Sector Seven plate tower allows him to rally the citizens of the slums and convinces the Shinra guards to open the gate between sectors, allowing him to evacuate the civilians and saving a lot more lives then in the original timeline.

[Stepford Smiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StepfordSmiler): Wedge might seem cheerful on the surface, but deep down he worries that he's [The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad) and isn't contributing anything worthwhile to the team.
[Verbal Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic): Most of his Japanese lines tends to end with "-ssu," a shortened, somewhat juvenile version of the formal "desu".

[Wide-Eyed Idealist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WideEyedIdealist): Despite Cloud’s protests otherwise, Wedge genuinely believes that Cloud is working with Avalanche on an altruistic basis to some degree, in contrast with the rest of the group acknowledging he’s only there because he’s being paid for it.

tropeName: You Are Better Than You Think You Are
tropeNotes: [You Are Better Than You Think You Are](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreBetterThanYouThinkYouAre): He thinks he doesn't pull much weight like the others, considering himself to be [The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad) of the cell. It takes some convincing from Aerith to make him pull himself together.  (SPOILER) He does, helping to evacuate Sector 7 by giving a [Dare to Be Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DareToBeBadass) speech to two Shinra guards blocking a gate. It's so convincing that [one of them defies orders and opens the gate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewTheRulesImDoingWhatsRight), letting the survivors through.

[24-Hour Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TwentyFourHourArmor): She's never seen without a chainmail vest with a metal chest plate over it, even when visiting her parents. While Biggs and Wedge also wear some form of combat gear, hers is by far the most conspicuous.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): She’s part of Avalanche, so it comes with the turf. She isn’t afraid to get physical with Shinra soldiers and she has a penchant for demolitions.

[Adaptation Personality Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationPersonalityChange): Jessie's behavior in the 1997 game leaned towards that of a demure, introspective young woman. The remake contrasts this by portraying her as someone who's always brimming with cheerful, hyperactive energy. She shamelessly crushes on Cloud and also flirts with him aggressively, whereas in the original, she does nothing else besides making a few subtle advances towards him.

[All Love Is Unrequited](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllLoveIsUnrequited): She quickly gains a crush on Cloud, and is very open about her interest in him. However, Cloud's own personal hangups leave him to finding Jessie's advances more annoying than anything, and when she tries to hug or be playful with him, he gets annoyed. Cloud does start warming up at the end of chapter 4 (especially if he agrees to consider her offer), but  (SPOILER) the next time he sees her after leaving for the next reactor job is when she's dying .

[All Women Are Lustful](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllWomenAreLustful): She is *very* forward about her attraction to Cloud. That said, Wedge states she's likely faking this, and that she views it as a game more then anything serious.
QUOTE  **Jessie:** *[while tightly embracing Cloud]* Mind coming over tomorrow night? My roommates should be out for a while.<br data-format="\\"/>**Cloud:** [Are you seriously that desperate?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveGotToBeKiddingMe)

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): Jessie  (SPOILER) seemingly perishes at the Sector 7 plate just as she did in the original, but the game then hints that she may have been [Spared by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SparedByTheAdaptation).

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Is more or less an NPC with not that much screentime in the original game. Jessie has a substantially larger role in the remake, complete with a brand new backstory and motivations. If it wasn't for her not being playable, she could easily come across as a main character.  (SPOILER) Because of this, she and Wedge cause most of the deviations in the original timeline, causing the Whispers to retaliate in fury and kill her.

[Barred from the Afterlife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarredFromTheAfterlife): As a practitioner of Planetology, Jessie's greatest fear is that  (SPOILER) her father's soul, which she believes is trapped somewhere between his comatose body and the Lifestream, will eventually be sucked up into a mako reactor and destroyed.   <sup>note </sup>  In *Final Fantasy VII Ultimania Omega* the trio have this same fear when Aerith finds them in the Lifestream, believing they killed too many people to be accepted. When Aerith reassures them they're not bad people and they did do good, they peacefully returned to the Lifestream.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): Entering her house without permission if you're a man is one,  <sup>note </sup>  though this could be a general house rule she shares with her roommates as she is eager to invite Cloud to come back when they aren't around  and  (SPOILER) telling other people about her dad's condition.  Both Wedge and Biggs worry big time that Jessie's gonna beat the shit out of them if she finds out they told Cloud about that.
[Breast Plate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreastPlate): Jessie wears a form-fitting cuirass that emphasizes her bust.
[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): "Psych!" Usually follows her flirting with Cloud, highlighting that it's seemingly all a game to her, or so Wedge claims.

[Continuity Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContinuityCameo):  (SPOILER)  *Remake* established that she used to be an actress at the Gold Saucer. When Cloud and the others go there in *Rebirth*, they discover her portrait and a pre-recorded play starring her.

[Cosmic Plaything](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CosmicPlaything): On top of all the crap in her life already and Shinra making her believe she's killed a countless number of people in their [False Flag Operation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FalseFlagOperation),  (SPOILER) the Arbiters of Fate specifically antagonize *her* for daring to go off the path of destiny. When Cloud is about to miss out on the Sector 5 bombing run, they attack the slums and then badly injure Jessie's leg to force Barret to suck up his pride and hire Cloud. And when she's recovered and has to prevent the Sector 7 plate fall, the Arbiters again go out of their way to near-directly cause her seeming death by her own grenade and then try to prevent Cloud and Tifa from reaching her in time to save her.  Poor girl needs a break.

[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): Winds up getting trapped under some rubble thanks to the damage caused to the reactor by the Scorpion Sentinel. Happens again when  (SPOILER) the Arbiters target her specifically so that her injured state forces Cloud to go on the mission he was otherwise just about to miss - and again when they cause her to get fatally injured in the battle for the plate support . Unfortunately for her,  (SPOILER) that last incident seemingly kills her .
[A Day in the Limelight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ADayInTheLimelight): The fourth chapter of the game is focused on Jessie’s backstory.
[Demolitions Expert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemolitionsExpert): She's the team's explosives specialist, creating bombs they use during their bombing runs.

[Dies Differently in Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiesDifferentlyInAdaptation):  (SPOILER) Not by Shinra forces or the plate drop like in the original, but what seems to be by the Arbiters of Fate detonating her own grenade right in front of her and being buried by rubble. She passes [in Cloud's arms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedInYourArmsTonight), telling him and Tifa not to be sad over her death, but the game hints she may have been [Spared by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SparedByTheAdaptation).

[Drama Queen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DramaQueen): Due to her past as an actress, she tends to dramatize things with over-the-top theatrical mannerisms. This is best seen during the Chapter 4 mission where she's constantly narrating things during the bike chase.

[Eating the Eye Candy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEyeCandy): She's very blatant about ogling Cloud. Biggs' reaction implies she does this often.
QUOTE **Biggs:** *[about Cloud]* Real joy to work with though.<br data-format="\\"/>**Jessie:** Real joy to look at too.<br data-format="\\"/>**Biggs:** [Here we go...](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HereWeGoAgain)<br data-format="\\"/>**Jessie:** Looks are what people notice first!
[The Engineer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEngineer): She's the one in the team who builds the bombs, gadgets, and equipment that they use in the missions.
[Gadgeteer Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GadgeteerGenius): She's the one who makes the fake identities and bombs utilized by their Avalanche cell.

[Hand Behind Head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandBehindHead): She puts her hand in her head in embarrassment while Barret is giving a [Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam) speech about the planet to an [uncaring Cloud](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotInThisForYourRevolution) in the Mako Reactor 1 elevator, seemingly finding the whole thing an [Uncomfortable Elevator Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncomfortableElevatorMoment).
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Before she joined AVALANCHE, she studied planetology, a form of science based around understanding the Lifestream and the planets nature.

[I Coulda Been a Contender!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ICouldaBeenAContender):  (SPOILER) Jessie was on the fast track to becoming an actress at the Gold Saucer, but when her father suffered his accident and went into a mako-induced coma, she was so distraught and desperate to help him that she dropped out to research a way to fix it. This lead her to being recruited by Barret.

[Irony](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Irony):  (SPOILER) Twofold. For one thing, as someone that was on the path to becoming a star actress at *the* biggest place for such a job, it's partly Jessie (and partly unforeseen circumstances) that causes the story to go wildly off-script enough for the Arbiters to get involved, even targeting her for it. For another, what does her in isn't bullets or being crushed by the plate fall - it's the Arbiters causing the bomb-maker's own grenade to *detonate in her face.*

[It's Personal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsPersonal): In Chapter 4 it's revealed that  (SPOILER) her father used to work at a reactor, and his severe mako poisoning is the reason Jessie joined Avalanche; quitting her job as an actress at the Gold Saucer to do so.

[Karmic Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmicDeath): Tragically [subverted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope); Jessie certainly feels that dying from her own explosives blowing up in her face is just what she deserves for all the deaths caused by her bombs, but the truth behind the reactor bombings actually leaves her with little-to-no blood on her hands at all, let alone explosives related blood.

tropeName: My God, What Have I Done?
tropeNotes: [My God, What Have I Done?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGodWhatHaveIDone): After Shinra self-destructs the Sector 1 mako reactor, Jessie is horrified and blames herself for the catastrophic devastation — thinking her bomb was responsible. She spends the rest of the game feeling that she did something wrong and works to try and fix it.
[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): She had no last name in the original, but now her family name is Rasberry.

["Shaggy Dog" Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShaggyDogStory): Her entire personal arc, mainly  (SPOILER) trying to recover her father from his mako poisoning coma as well as reduce collateral in the Sector 5 bombing , ultimately tumbles in on itself for reasons entirely out of her control and culminating in all of her hard work blowing up in her face.  (SPOILER) Literally, thanks to the Arbiters.

[Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease): She displays a noticeable interest in Cloud, remarking to Biggs that he's easy on the eyes, frequently flirting with him throughout the bombing mission, asking him out of the blue what his [relationship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriend) with Tifa is, and inviting him into her home where they can be alone. And if the players keep their health above a certain threshold during the motorcycle ride in Chapter 4, she will give Cloud a kiss on the cheek.

[The Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTease): She's very flirtatious towards Cloud, [even during a dangerous mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlirtingUnderFire). However, Wedge warns Cloud that Jessie's affections may not be serious.
QUOTE **Jessie:** *[if spoken to while in the reactor core chamber]* Aw, you're choosing me over the reactor? That's sweet, but I'll wait my turn. Go blow her mind.

[Third-Option Love Interest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirdOptionLoveInterest): Jessie is introduced in the remake as a potential third love interest for Cloud along with his famous canonical love interests Tifa and Aerith with an entire chapter of the game dedicated to her flirting with him and (potentially) kissing him.

[Adaptation Expansion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationExpansion): In the original game, Mayor Domino helps the party out of boredom more than anything else, and his only role is to give them a key card if they guess the word he's thinking. In *Remake*, he becomes Avalanche's man on the inside, though he notes Barret's cell must not have gotten the memo, and helps cover their tracks as they infiltrate the Shinra headquarters.

[Adaptational Intelligence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalIntelligence): In the original game he just gave the party a keycard and nothing more. In this game, he's a secret ally of Avalanche who can hack Shinra's security systems under their noses.

[Adaptational Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalJerkass): Downplayed. Mayor Domino in the original game was bitter and snarky, but also a kooky and helpful man. In this game, he is quite proud of his position as Mayor of Midgar, which he declares the greatest city in the world, and only helps the party specifically because he wants them to stick it to President Shinra. He quite clearly has no qualms with the terrible things Shinra has done, just with how they've marginalized his authority.

[Authority in Name Only](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AuthorityInNameOnly): Despite being the mayor of the most advanced metropolis on the planet, his office is just another floor in Shinra's massive HQ, while he himself has been reduced to little more than a desk jockey.
QUOTE **Cloud:** But you're the mayor.<br data-format="\\"/>**Domino:** ["But you're the mayor"!?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CopycatMockery) Does this look like the office of a mayor? I'm a glorified librarian, nothing more! They don't even invite me to their meetings!
[Continuity Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContinuityCameo): Makes a cameo in the Cosmo Canyon protorelic mission that details how Wedge met him in Shinra tower.

[The Cracker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCracker): Mayor Domino is skilled in cracking Shinra's security systems and communications, which he uses to cover up the party's tracks during their infiltration of Shinra HQ.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): He may be an old man and a "glorified librarian," but he's also a skilled hacker capable of quickly doctoring security footage and disabling alarms.
[Mistreatment-Induced Betrayal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MistreatmentInducedBetrayal): He helps Avalanche infiltrate Shinra HQ because he's angry at them for marginalizing his authority.

[The Mole](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMole): Domino is covertly an Avalanche member that is situated deep inside Shinra underneath their noses. He mostly uses his position to cover up the presence of any Avalanche member that is inside enemy territory.

tropeName: Not in This for Your Revolution
tropeNotes: [Not in This for Your Revolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotInThisForYourRevolution): He aids Avalanche less out of concern for the planet and more out of anger and frustration at having had his political authority stripped away, relegating him to a mere record-keeper.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given one name, and it's unclear if "Domino" is a first name or a family name.

[Punny Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunnyName): As in the original game, his name is derived from the Domino's Pizza take out franchise. As he is the mayor of a pizza-shaped city, it effectively makes Midgar *Domino's pizza*.

[Puppet King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PuppetKing): He's theoretically the mayor of Midgar, but in practice Shinra rules everything. He's more than a tad bitter about this arrangement, and helps Avalanche to screw over Shinra because of it.
[But Now I Must Go](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButNowIMustGo): After Sonon and Yuffie rescue him from Shinra, he leaves and... that's it.
[Delinquent Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DelinquentHair): A spiky bleached blond 'do.
[Jack Bauer Interrogation Technique](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackBauerInterrogationTechnique): Is subjected to some of this by the Shinra soldiers who capture him.
[Odd Name Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddNameOut): Amongst the the traditionally Japanese influenced Wutaians, Zhijie's name is notable for being a real world *Chinese* name.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Small Role, Big Impact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallRoleBigImpact):  (SPOILER) He's the first one to discover Shinra's plot to drop the plate on Sector 7 and is the one who warns the rest of AVALANCHE about the coming disaster.
[Talking Your Way Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingYourWayOut): Subverted, he attempts this when captured by Shinra soldiers, but fails miserably.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom):  (SPOILER) Vanishes from the story after  INTERmission  Ch. 1, with no mention of what happened to him when the plate fell. Subverted in *Rebirth,* when it's revealed that he survived when the party meets him in Cosmo Canyon.
[Bespectacled Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BespectacledCutie): Cute as a button and never seen without her glasses.

[Buxom Beauty Standard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuxomBeautyStandard): Her buxom figure is implied to be what causes Don Corneo's goons to come after her, as they're looking for a busty girl to be Corneo's new bride. They only stop hounding Nayo after they find a similarly busty candidate (Tifa).

[Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeMagnet): Ambient dialogue suggests she's the object of affection of a couple of people in the slums. Not to mention she's attractive enough to get the attention of Corneo's bride scouts.

[Ms. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsExposition): Her role in  INTERmission  is to explain to Yuffie (and thus the player) the current dynamics between Avalanche, Barret's splinter cell, and Wutai. She also ends up being the one to explain the mako-poisoned to Yuffie.

[Nerds Are Sexy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NerdsAreSexy): In addition to being a [Bespectacled Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BespectacledCutie), she even wears a mini skirt and thigh-high socks to emphasize this. She's considered beautiful enough that Corneo's henchmen try to pick her up to be one of his "brides".

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): She doesn't have a mean bone in her body and is very friendly towards Yuffie and Sonon, despite their eccentricities. Her kind nature is also explicitly why she disapproves of Barret's Avalanche cell, as she can't bear the idea of innocent people getting killed. Yuffie is shocked by this, and ends up liking Nayo more than she expected.

[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): Appears to be around the same age as Yuffie but Corneo's cronies recognize her as "a woman" while noting that Yuffie is [Just a Kid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustAKid) (much to Yuffie's annoyance).
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only given a first name, and her surname is never given.

[Properly Paranoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperlyParanoid): Nayo's branch was quick to work with Wutai, despite their wildly clashing stances, out of fear that they would ally with Barret's faction instead and that such an alliance would destroy Midgar. This fear turns out to be entirely justified, as once Sonon and Yuffie are in private they agree that Barret's faction would have been a much better choice of allies.

[So Beautiful, It's a Curse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoBeautifulItsACurse): Her being so attractive is what gets her on the radar of Don Corneo's goons, and she needs Yuffie and Sonon's help to fight them off.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom): It isn't known if  (SPOILER) she was in Midgar when the plate fell, and if she survived .  (SPOILER)  Her appearance in *Rebirth*, alongside Polk and Billy Bob, shows that she survived.

[Wide-Eyed Idealist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WideEyedIdealist): While Sonon and Yuffie appreciate how much of a [Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl) she is, they both ultimately conclude she's too soft for an effective Avalanche operative. As Sonon puts it: "Midgar doesn't need good people".

[Aerith and Bob](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AerithAndBob): *Literally*. In a world with names like Cloud, Tifa, Sephiroth, and of course, [Aerith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TropeNamer), we finally have a Bob.
[Alliterative Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlliterativeName): **B**illy **B**ob.
[Never Gets Drunk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverGetsDrunk): He is known for never getting drunk despite his heavy drinking.

[Out of Focus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutOfFocus): Out of all members of Avalanche HQ he's the one with the least to do in  INTERmission , as Nayo and Zhijie are involved in the main story while Polk is involved with the Fort Condor minigame.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom): Vanishes from the story after  INTERmission  Ch. 1, with no mention of what happened to him  (SPOILER) when the plate fell. He returns in *Rebirth*, confirming his survival .
[Flat Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlatCharacter): His only contribution to the story is the introduction of the Fort Condor minigame.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom): Vanishes from the story after  INTERmission  Ch. 1, with no mention of what happened to him  (SPOILER) when the plate fell .  (SPOILER)  His appearance in *Rebirth*, alongside Nayo, confirms that he survived.

[Zero-Effort Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroEffortBoss): The game of Fort Condor with him basically serves as a tutorial form the minigame as a whole, as such it's virtually impossible to lose to him unless you deliberately do so.

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): She's not the type to mince her words and tells people what's on her mind with little filter and comes across as very rude even if she means well. Her very first interaction with Tifa in *Trace of Two Pasts* has her openly telling Tifa she's too naive and that she'll need to harden herself to survive the slums, which shocks Tifa, but she admits Marle is right.
QUOTE **Marle:** You’re the kind of girl who doesn’t like to make waves. The teeniest bit of pressure, and you’ll fold like a cheap suitcase.

[Cranky Landlord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrankyLandlord): [Subverted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope). She seems like the stereotypical cranky old landlord in her interactions with Cloud, but is actually fairly benevolent to the other tenants, even allowing a Mako-poisoned tenant like Marco to stay there so she and Tifa can look out for him.  INTERmission  also shows she's been training a dog to look after Stargazer Heights so nobody can bother her tenants.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): She has a wry demeanor and a witty tongue. She has zero tolerance for Cloud's aloofness and seems to enjoy taking him down a peg by mocking him.

[Did You Just Have Sex?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustHaveSex): Subverted; provided that all of the sidequests in Chapter 3 are completed, and after the bonus scene in Cloud's apartment where the player chooses the dress Tifa will later wear in Chapter 9, Marle has this reaction when the pair exit the apartment and are acting happier.
[Good Is Not Nice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodIsNotNice): She's one of the pillars of the community in the Sector 7 slums and the neighborhood watch, but has a harsh and abrasive demeanor.

tropeName: If You Ever Do Anything to Hurt Her...
tropeNotes: [If You Ever Do Anything to Hurt Her...](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IfYouEverDoAnythingToHurtHer): She sees Tifa as her granddaughter and gives Cloud several warnings to treat her well.
[Intergenerational Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntergenerationalFriendship): She's one of Tifa's best friends in the slums, and they get along well despite being decades apart in age.

[I Was Quite a Looker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWasQuiteALooker): *Trace of Two Pasts* reveals she was apparently quite attractive in her youth, and that she had her "glamour days" when working in Wall Market.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): Marle can be abrasive, rude, and judgmental, especially to those she doesn't trust (like Cloud in *Remake* and Barret in *Trace of Two Pasts*) but deep down she's a good woman who cares deeply about her community. Most of the young girls in the Sector look up to her as some kind of matriarchal figure and she's a well-respected and active member of the neighborhood watch, taking charge of the evacuation of the slums during the fall of the Sector 7 plate at the risk of her own life despite her old age.
