[Adult Hater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdultHater): [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope). He doesn't allow any "grown-ups" near the frog-turning playground but makes an exception for the party due to hearing about how they helped out Priscilla with Terror of the Deep.
[Morphic Resonance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorphicResonance): His frog model is unique much like the party, being the same color as his shirt and keeping his straw hat.
[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "Calling All Frogs", where the party helps him clear the monsters from the frog-turning playground.

[Signature Headgear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignatureHeadgear): He's always wearing a straw hat, which distinguishes him from the other kids. [He even still has it on as a frog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorphicResonance).

[Tsundere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tsundere): When Tifa asks him if he's friends with Priscilla, he replies with a "We're friends but it's not like I like her or anything", which is an obvious hint he has a crush on her but is in denial about it.

[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): To Barrett's surprise, Salmon never really needed any bodyguarding to begin with to make his delivery; he's more than capable of traversing rough terrain and running past fiends without much issue, but Rhonda wanted some piece of mind over his safety anyway.

[Escort Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EscortMission): His sole appearance in the game requires Cloud and co. to escort him to the Crow's Nest to deliver money to Rhonda's son, defending him all the while.

[Leitmotif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leitmotif): Two, no less, as he gets his very own remixes of [Stamp's](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1TeTmoC94BY) [theme](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ftFF70_9cog) during his sidequest.
[The Casanova](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCasanova): He never flirts with anyone in the party, but ambient dialogue at the Crow's Nest makes it clear he's a huge flirt.
[Cool Shades](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolShades): He's always wearing a pair of sunglasses, seemingly just for the cool factor. Even his Chocobo has one.
[Fan Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FanBoy): He's a huge fanboy of Avalanche and starts gushing about them the moment he recognizes the party.

[Jive Turkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JiveTurkey): Uses slang in his dialogue to illustrate how he's a "hip rebel", such as calling Dillan "Dilster" or referring to people from Midgar as "Midgarinos".
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "The Hardest Sell", where he asks the party to investigate the "new merc" (Kyrie) who set up shop in the abandoned lighthouse.
[Hand on Womb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandOnWomb): Claire is introduced with a zoom-in of her hand on her belly, to make it obvious to the audience that she's pregnant.
[Like Father, Like Son](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeFatherLikeSon): Barret calls him out for being a stubborn hardass just like his mother.

[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): It's never stated why exactly Dillan dislikes his mother, only that they had a falling out that caused him to leave Under Junon and want nothing to do with her anymore.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): Both of them aren't given any surnames.

[Satellite Love Interest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SatelliteLoveInterest): Claire mostly exists as an extent of Dillan, being the pregnant girlfriend he's settling down with at Crow's Nest, and the reason Rhonda is worried about him.

[Unable to Support a Wife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnableToSupportAWife): While Dillan is reluctant to take his mother's money, he ultimately does so for Claire and their future child's sake, as making money in a place like Crow's Nest isn't easy.

[I Owe You My Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IOweYouMyLife): He has a special attachment to the Condor because it saved his life during the war, snatching him away after he got grievously injured by Shinra troops and flying him to the next town where he got treatment. The incident left him without the use of his legs, but he still feels indebted to the Condor.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "Dreaming of Blue Skies", where he asks the party to help him make a meal for the Great Condor to lure him out and make sure he's healthy.
[The Captain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCaptain): He's the captain of the *Shinra-8* and is known for being a consummate professional who's well respected by his crew.

[Combat Commentator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatCommentator): During the Queen's Blood tournament, he'll provide commentary during your matches, having different lines depending on who's currently leading.

[Family Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyBusiness): According to ambient dialogue, The Shinra-8 used to belong to his father, who used to perform the same trip, as was seized by Shinra after the war with the Republic of Junon, who allowed Titov to keep sailing it. Sailors say Titov apparently does have plans to take it back from Shinra one day.

tropeName: I Did What I Had to Do
tropeNotes: [I Did What I Had to Do](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IDidWhatIHadToDo): When his ship is attacked by fiends that are merging with the black-robed men, and he finds out that there is no support coming from Shinra (and *especially* not Hojo, [who treats the whole thing like one of his experiments](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForScience)) he takes it upon himself to  (SPOILER) shoot the remaining black robes before the fiends can merge with them, in order to protect his passengers and crew .

[Nerves of Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NervesOfSteel): During the fiend attack on the ship, he keeps a calm temper, even when talking to a ranting Hojo, who makes it clear to Titov that no help is coming for them.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given one name, and it's unclear if "Titov" is a first name or a family name.

[Reasonable Authority Figure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReasonableAuthorityFigure): During the Queen's Blood tournament, he allows Red XIII to challenge Cloud for an exhibition match, despite clearly seeing through Red's [Paper-Thin Disguise](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaperThinDisguise).

[Big Fun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFun): Subverted. On the surface, he is a heavyset man who encourages visitors to have fun at his coastal resort town, but underneath his friendly facade is a ruthless con artist.

[Bitch in Sheep's Clothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BitchInSheepsClothing): While he likes to present himself as the generous mayor of Costa del Sol, in truth he's as wicked as they come according to Mireille. For instance, he "helped' Johnny set up his own business in the town by selling him an inn for a low price and gave him him a loan to cover the cost, but the loan was more than what the inn was worth and Kapono didn't expect him to be able to pay it off, and in return the property he sold him was a dump in a bad location that needed a *lot* of work to fix up into something livable. He also shows more concern over the destruction to the town than the safety of the townsfolk in the wake of Hojo's attack, and is happy to have played a part in it since it means he'll be a "footnote" in Shinra's history books.

[Laser-Guided Karma](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserGuidedKarma): For scamming Johnny, accepting bribes from Shinra to keep Hojo's attack secret, and hiring Cloud to kill Kyrie, among other misdeeds, he gets his money cleaned out by her and her grandmother.

[Never Say "Die"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverSayDie): He hires Kyrie to hunt down some monsters since she claims to be a mercenary, only for her to run off and use the money to party. Afterwards, he hires Cloud to complete the job Kyrie was supposed to do, but also ask Cloud to ["take care of her"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlyEuphemism) after the job is done.
[Professional Butt-Kisser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProfessionalButtKisser): To Shinra, particularly to Hojo during the mad scientist's stay at Costa del Sol.
[Adaptation Dye-Job](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationDyeJob): They were all brunettes in the original *Final Fantasy VII*, their new designs change Fran and Naomi to be a blonde and a redhead.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): They're based on the nameless female  NPCs  that were fawning over Hojo in the original *Final Fantasy VII*. In *Rebirth* have an expanded role, unique designs and personalities, and their own quest.

[Baby Factory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BabyFactory): Hojo offers them positions at Shinra as his lab assistants, and asks if they would be interested in helping give birth to the "world's next hero," apparently wanting conventionally attractive women to mother his next creations so that they will have more "heroic" appearances from inheriting their parents' beauty. Thankfully, none of the three are foolish enough to actually take Hojo up on his offer considering it is implied that Hojo  (SPOILER) plans to put them through the same process as Lucrecia that resulted in Sephiroth's creation, or have them be impregnated by the mutated Sephiroth Clones .
[Blonde, Brunette, Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlondeBrunetteRedhead): Fran, Yorda, and Naomi respectively.

[The Dividual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDividual): Although they are quite different from each other in terms of appearances, they are pretty interchangeable personality-wise and are rarely apart from each other for very long.

[The Fashionista](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFashionista): All three of them are designers for Costa del Sol's premier fashion boutique. During the "Rendezvous in Costa del Sol" side quest, they will ask Cloud and Aerith to help provide them with inspiration for their next line of clothes. Their sidequest ends with them finishing and donning said outfits, and posing for them at the beach.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Despite being introduced as Hojo's [Paid Harem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaidHarem) and seemingly looking like shallow [Brainless Beauties](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainlessBeauty), talking to them after he is gone reveals that they are fashion designers who get their inspiration from seeing people having fun in their hometown, and their behavior with Hojo was just them sucking up to a Shinra executive.

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Invoked, as they are highly attractive women clad in swimwear who were  (SPOILER) hired by Mayor Kapono to be Hojo's [Paid Harem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaidHarem) .

[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): They were nameless in the original game, but in the remakes they will properly introduce themselves to Cloud if he talks to them again after the incident with Hojo is over.

[No Accounting for Taste](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoAccountingForTaste): They fawn over [Hojo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist) as they attend to him. This is later  (SPOILER) subverted after they clarify to Cloud they were with Hojo as a favor to their mayor and their flirtatious behavior was only an act. They have no interest in Hojo beyond the fact that he is a company bigwig who can help advance their business .
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): They're only given a first name, and their surname is never given.

[Paid Harem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaidHarem): They gush over Hojo and attend to him during his stay at Costa del Sol. However, they soon reveal to Cloud that  (SPOILER) they were only hired by Mayor Kapono to butter up the Shinra executive, and could barely even remember Hojo's name once they're done with him .

[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): They will give out the sidequest "Rendezvous in Costa del Sol" in Chapter 7 of *Rebirth*, where they ask Cloud and Aerith to do dating activities as a means to provide them with inspiration for their next clothing line.
[Security Cling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecurityCling): All three cling to Hojo in fear once he activates the Grasptropod and unleashes it on the robed men and the party.

[Sheep in Sheep's Clothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SheepInSheepsClothing): Considering they associate themselves with people like Hojo and [Mayor Kapono](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BitchInSheepsClothing), it would be easy to assume that Fran, Naomi, and Yorda must be pretty unscrupulous themselves. However, in turns out that the trio are actually nice people who want nothing more than to see visitors having fun in their town and make their customers happy with their clothing designs. It is also implied that they  (SPOILER) helped Johnny get out of debt by threatening to smear the mayor's name after Johnny help save Costa del Sol from Hojo's attack .

[Shipper on Deck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck): To Cloud and Aerith, as they assume that Cloud has a thing for assertive women. Their sidequest is basically the trio setting up Cloud and Aerith on a date.

[Walking Swimsuit Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSwimsuitScene): Their main outfits are their fancy bikinis. [Justified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope) since they spend all their screentime in a beach resort.

[Yes-Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YesMan): They pretty much just agree with everything that Hojo says even when he is basically propositioning them to be [Breeding Slaves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreedingSlave) for his next experiment. Although, they do refuse the offer on grounds of the position being "too lofty" for them. Considering that they  (SPOILER) were paid to butter up Hojo, they likely don't truly agree with anything he tells them .

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): She's vaguely based on Johnny's nameless girlfriend in Costal del Sol, who remained in the shower for the entire duration of *Final Fantasy VII*. Now she has a name, and personality and actually gets to interact with the party.

[Clingy Jealous Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClingyJealousGirl): She acts hostile toward Tifa because Jenny knows that Johnny has a crush on her. Jenny does lighten up when Tifa explains to Jenny that she only views Johnny as a friend, and gives Jenny her blessing to pursue a relationship with Johnny.

[Distaff Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DistaffCounterpart): In many ways, she's a female version of Johnny, including sharing his exuberant personality, fiery temper, and habit of getting carried away with their assumptions. Even her name is just a female counterpart to Johnny's.

[Fiery Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FieryRedhead): Her hair is primarily red with orange and yellow streaks. Fittingly, she is very [Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded) and has a short temper to match her flame-like hair.
[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): It's strongly implied that she is Johnny's would-be unnamed girlfriend from the original game.

[Perky Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerkyGoth): Wears a black leather jacket along with a spiked collar and bracelet, but is a [Fiery Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FieryRedhead) who can be quite cheerful when she doesn't let her [Clingy Jealous Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClingyJealousGirl) tendency get the best of her.

[Canon Character All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonCharacterAllAlong): "Doctor Sheiran" was first introduced in *[Trace of Two Pasts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/FinalFantasyVIIRemakeTraceOfTwoPasts)* as the doctor responsible for reconstructing Tifa's sternum after it was pierced by Sephiroth, and *Rebirth* marks his [first appearance in a video game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonImmigrant) while also revealing he's actually based on the unseen and unnamed doctor who fixed up Barret's arm in the original *Final Fantasy VII*.

[Connected All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConnectedAllAlong): It's revealed that not only was he the one who saved Tifa's life after she was slashed by Sephiroth, but he was also the one who operated on Barret following the razing of Corel.

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): He's a kindhearted, selfless doctor who works tirelessly for the people of North Corel, using his medical skills and connections with Shinra to try to help the community. He's notable for being the only person in North Corel who doesn't hold a grudge against Barret.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as "Doctor Sheiran" and it's unclear if that's his first name or his family name.

[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "Of Robed Men and Ransoms", where he asks the party to find the black-robed man who got kidnapped from his clinic by robbers who are demanding a ransom Sheiran can't pay.

[Adaptational Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalBadass): In *Rebirth*, he reveals that his muscles are not just for show as he is able to stand toe-to-toe with Rude and help Cloud's party escape after they prove their innocence.  (SPOILER) Though as we see later, the fight ultimately did not go in his favor, leaving him covered in bandages and an arm in a sling.
[Adaptational Heroism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalHeroism): After giving the group the buggy, Dio personally throws down against Rude to give them a chance to escape.

[Adaptational Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalNiceGuy): In the original, he finds the party standing over the corpses of the Shinra soldiers and instantly assumes the they are responsible and has them forcibly tossed in a hole leading to Corel's Prison. In *Rebirth*, he (understandably) is suspicious of the party since their faces are on a Shinra wanted poster and eyewitnesses said a man with a gun for an arm did the shooting, which makes Barret the prime suspect. However, he gives the party 24 hours to prove themselves innocent before handing them over to Shinra. Even after the party proves their innocence  (SPOILER) he comforts Barret, swearing to give Dyne a proper burial despite his massacre at the Gold Saucer.
[Carpet of Virility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CarpetOfVirility): Has a patch of it adorning his chest.
[Hunk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hunk): He's a well-built, manly, and handsome man who enjoys showing off his musculature.
[Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair): His moustache practically looks like its flexing its own pecs.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as "Dio" and it's unclear if that's even his actual name or a stage name.
[Pec Flex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PecFlex): He's known to flex his muscles to show off his muscular body.
[Reasonable Authority Figure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReasonableAuthorityFigure): In *Rebirth*, he is portrayed as a very charismatic figure who is fair in judgment and honorable.
[The Strongman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStrongman): Design-wise he is clearly based on one.

[Unskilled, but Strong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnskilledButStrong): Implied by  (SPOILER) his mostly offscreen fight with Rude. He could hold his own when matching him on terms of strength, but considering that Rude turns up uninjured not long after and Dio is seen bruised and in a sling several days after, the Turk's better training and experience was more than he could handle .
[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): He proudly parades about his park dressed only in [Underwear of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnderwearOfPower) and a cape.
[Adaptational Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalNameChange): Her name was spelled "Ester" in the original *Final Fantasy VII* but was changed to "Esther" in *Rebirth*.
[Bare Midriffs Are Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareMidriffsAreFeminine): Her uniform leaves her midriff bare to emphasize her femininity.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as "Esther" and it's unclear if that's her first name, a family name, or even a stage name.
[The Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTease): She often flirts with Cloud during the period they're working together.
[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): Esther reluctantly admits he's one of the best Chocobo jockeys in the sport.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Animal Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotifs): He has a thing for vultures, not only keeping actual vultures as pets and training them but also using them as his personal symbol, as vultures are seen in graffiti all over Corel Prison.

[Beware the Silly Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheSillyOnes): Although Gus is very eccentric and flamboyant, he is still the gang leader of Coral Prison whose thugs were able to subdue the party into compliance, and  (SPOILER) capture [Dyne](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoaringRampageOfRevenge) .

[I Gave My Word](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IGaveMyWord): Despite being the leader of an [Outlaw Town](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutlawTown) and threatening to sell Aerith, Tifa, and Yuffie into prostitution if Cloud fails to win the Chocobo race, he promises to let everyone go and give them directions to the gunman responsible for shooting up the Gold Saucer if Cloud wins. When Cloud wins, Gus keeps his word and lets everyone run free.

[Gold Tooth of Wealth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldToothOfWealth): He has teeth made of gold, which denotes his status and wealth as the [criminal head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDon) of an [Outlaw Town](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutlawTown).

[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): He was only known as "Mr. Coates" in the original *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*, but is given a proper name in *Rebirth*.
[Non-Indicative Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonIndicativeName): "Solemn" Gus is anything but, instead being a [Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam).

tropeName: Slavery Is a Special Kind of Evil
tropeNotes: [Slavery Is a Special Kind of Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlaveryIsASpecialKindOfEvil): After forcing Cloud to participate in a Chocobo Race, he says that if he doesn't win he will make up the gil by selling the rest of his party. Later, Leslie tells the party that Gus is putting a woman up for the prize in his arena. That pushes Tifa's dislike of slavery so far that she kicks him over and tells him she will do worse if she ever hears him doing it again when the party wins.

[Beware the Silly Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheSillyOnes): Garth can be just as eccentric as his boss and comically acts as Gus's hype-man. However, he was able to knock out Cloud with a single hit with his bat, and likely was among the group who  (SPOILER) captured and tied up Dyne .

[Cutscene Power to the Max](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutscenePowerToTheMax): In his first scene, he knocks Cloud unconscious with a single bat swing to the head, despite Cloud facing opponents much stronger than Garth.
[Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass): He's an asshole criminal who is insulting and demeaning to Cloud in most of their interactions.
[Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo): He acts as Gus' main enforcer in Corel Prison, including playing nanny for Cloud during the time he's working for Gus.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): He's based on the baby chicks the party could run into in Mt. Corel. In *Rebirth* he's found in the main story and is the focus of a sidequest.

[Named In The Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedInTheAdaptation): Was just an unnamed baby chick in the original *Final Fantasy VII*, in *Rebirth* the party names him "Cloud Jr." due to him resembling Cloud's hair and the kids in North Corel are revealed to call him "Mr. Birdie"
[Parrot Pet Position](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParrotPetPosition): After being saved by the party, he travels with them for a bit while staying on Barret's shoulder.
[Team Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamPet): He acts as a pet to the kids of North Corel and the "Mr. Birdie" sidequest involves the party tracking him down for them.

[Adaptational Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalBadass): Goblins were wimpy random encounters in the original game, notable for little more than being the source of the Goblin Punch enemy skill. Kid G meanwhile is *vicious* in a fight, zipping around the battlefield at speeds comparable to a Cactuar and with a full complement of unblockable attacks and counters to round out his moveset.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): When Yuffie expresses shock at a monster being capable of speech, he snarks that speech isn't that hard to master, and points to Red XIII as proof.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): He moves fast, hits hard, and has more HP than most minibosses the party encounters.
[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): He's an optional miniboss who challenges you to a friendly fight at the end of the protorelic quest chain in Corel.
[Red Boxing Gloves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBoxingGloves): Kid G wears a pair of bright red boxing gloves, and fights using his fists to dole out powerful punches.
[Token Heroic Orc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenHeroicOrc): While goblins are a recurring enemy, Kid G stands out by wearing human clothes and isn't antagonistic towards Cloud's team.

[Adaptation Expansion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationExpansion): She was not present in the original *Final Fantasy VII* (being introduced in the prequel *Before Crisis* and getting an expanded role in another prequel *Crisis Core*) but now is part of the main plotline in Gongaga.

[Asskicking Leads to Leadership](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AsskickingLeadsToLeadership): Her advanced combat abilities are why she was made the captain of the Gongaga Youth Coalition, despite being a "newcomer from the big city".

[Connected All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConnectedAllAlong): *Rebirth* implies she's familiar with Reeve (due to her interactions and familiarity with Cait Sith) and Cid (as she's the one who recommends him to the party as a pilot).
[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): Just like her original self, this version of Cissnei is both adorable and kind.

[Defector from Decadence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefectorFromDecadence): In *Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion*, when she finds out Zack is one of her targets and that he was a guinea pig in Shinra manor for five years, she betrays the Shinra by allowing him to escape, also covering for him when he goes to Gongaga. *Rebirth* implies that she has defected from the company for good as she doesn't deny it when Cloud deduces she's ex-Shinra.
[Fashionable Asymmetry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FashionableAsymmetry): Her outfit in *Rebirth* has a studded leather shoulder cauldron only on her right shoulder.
[Fuma Shuriken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FumaShuriken): Her weapon is a large shuriken named Rekka she can use with deadly precision.

[The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader): She's captain of the Gongaga Youth Coalition, using her former Turk training to help the town form a militia to defend themselves now that the reactor exploding left the village in a fragile state.
[Lethal Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LethalChef): Shown to struggle significantly with cooking, citing her dependence on Shinra's meals during her time in the Turks as the reason why.

[Mysterious Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysteriousPast): Nobody in Gongaga knows about her past other than she previously came from Midgar. The game itself treats it as an [Open Secret](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OpenSecret) and the party figures out a lot on their own.

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Easily the nicest among the members of the Turks, current or former. It even reaches to the point she defects from them, letting Zack escape from Shinra's sights.

[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Cissnei, which in *Crisis Core* she admitted is *not* her real name. But is the one she uses in her new identity in Gongaga anyway.

[Open Secret](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OpenSecret): While she's trying to keep her past a secret in *Rebirth*, the fact she's ex-Shinra is made very clear to the audience even if they're not familiar with her, and Cloud himself deduces it eventually, and even correctly suspects she's a former Turk. Chadley will outright state she's a Turk when they meet, though she tries to shush him.

[Secret-Keeper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretKeeper): She recognizes who Cloud is instantly, but tries to hide it. If Cloud confronts her later about it, she'll admit she has met him but refuses to elaborate further.

[Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease): Had a lot of flirtatious banter with Zack in *Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion*. When she aids Zack and Cloud into getting to Gongaga, Zack's parents even ask her to "join the family" (read, marry Zack) when she talks to them. In *Rebirth* she seems to have defected from Shinra and decided to stay in Gongaga and protect the town (and Zack's parents) for his sake, basically adopting them as Zack's last request for her was to keep his parents' company. She'll admit to Cloud and Aerith she's still "waiting for someone special" to return to Gongaga one day.

[Significant Wardrobe Shift](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignificantWardrobeShift): *Rebirth* shows her in very different clothes than her [Turks uniform](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassInANiceSuit). Her outfit looks like a civilian mockup of a SOLDIER uniform,  (SPOILER) likely done out of remembrance of Zack .

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): As one of the Turks, she was the one ray of sunshine in an organization known full well for its ruthless efficiency and unscrupulous work. Her leaving has arguably made them even worse.
[Too Many Belts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooManyBelts): Her new outfit in *Rebirth* has equipment strapped to herself with belts everywhere.

[True Sight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueSight): Just like Rufus, she's one of the few people who can perceive the Whispers outside the party, which shocks Red XIII. Ironically she had no idea they were [Invisible to Normals](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InvisibleToNormals) and just assumed they were odd fiends.
[Tyke Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TykeBomb): She was an orphan who was "adopted" by the Turks so they could raise her to be one of them from an early age, which is why she has no family of her own.

[Childhood Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriends): He grew up in Gongaga alongside Zack and the two used to hang out together in the village. He says they lost contact after Zack left to join SOLDIER, but he still remembers Zack fondly, even (badly) imitating his squatting habit.
[City Guards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CityGuards): He's part of Gongaga's voluntary militia, and tells Cloud and Yuffie he joined out of a desire to protect his home.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): During the sidequest "Teach Me, Great Warrior" he "joins" the party in combat for the training missions Yuffie cooked up for him, although he's pretty weak, so the combat training also turns into an [Escort Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EscortMission).
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.
[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the sidequest "Teach Me, Great Warrior", where he asks Yuffie to train him to be a better warrior.

tropeName: Why Didn't I Think of That?
tropeNotes: [Why Didn't I Think of That?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhyDidntIThinkOfThat): His sidequest ends with Cissnei getting annoyed with him for not asking *her*, his superior, to be the one to train him and the rest of his Gongaga Youth Coalition buddies. It apparently just didn't occur to him.
[Canine Companion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanineCompanion): He owns a clever dog named Melon, who goes by himself to the village to sell Torgan's produce with a basket tied to him.
[Escort Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EscortMission): Much like Salmon, the party has to escort Melon while he sniffs out the Gongaga salt rocks Cissnei tasked the party to find.

[Half-Witted Hillbilly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HalfWittedHillbilly): He's a prejudiced old farmer who dislikes "out-of-towners", especially if they're "city folk" and refuses to sell his produce to them. Aerith manages to charm him by playing into his ego and buttering him up by complimenting his plants and saying until he agrees to help the party.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[The Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBlacksmith): He's a perfectionist blacksmith who loves smithing weapons, and has the goal to one day create the "ultimate weapon". His sidequest involves him building the Fafnir Rifle for Barret.

[Black Sheep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackSheep): Ambient dialogue in Gongaga village reveals he's not popular with the locals due to being loud [Cloudcuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Cloudcuckoolander). One villager even uses the term "black sheep" to describe Izo.

[Cloudcuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Cloudcuckoolander): He's obsessed with making weapons and becomes particularly focused on Barret's [Arm Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArmCannon), to the point even Cloud and Barret think he's weirdo, even if a "weirdo with a heart of gold".
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.

[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "The Pursuit of Perfection", where he tasks the party with finding the ingredients needed for him to build the "perfect weapon".

[Ultimate Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UltimateBlacksmith): His [Goal in Life](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoalInLife) is to become the ultimate weaponsmith who can craft the "ultimate weapon". His quest involves him building a weapon for Barret.

[Eat The Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatTheDog): [Played for Laughs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedForLaughs).  (SPOILER)  Despite her seemingly treating her chickens like pets, she doesn't hesitate to slaughter one so she can feed it to the party as thanks for helping her. Red XIII (who bonded with the chickens, but loves meat) felt very conflicted about it, but ate the grilled chicken anyway .
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only given a first name, and his surname is never given.
[Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeNaming): She names all of her chickens similarly: Pippily, Pippity, Pippi, Pete, Peepy, and Peep.
[Quest Giver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuestGiver): He gives out the quest "O Chicken, Where Art Thou ", where she asks the party to bring back all her chickens after they ran away from their coop.

[Arbitrary Skepticism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArbitrarySkepticism): Despite being the foremost authority on planetology, he immediately dismisses  (SPOILER) Tifa's claims of having been inside the Lifestream , and that what he believes to be the cries of the Planet are actually  (SPOILER) the roars of a pair of Weapons fighting Sephiroth's corrupted Whispers . He later admits that he was wrong to do so, and that his old age has turned his wisdom into arrogance.

[Keeper of Forbidden Knowledge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KeeperOfForbiddenKnowledge): Bugenhagen knows the truth of the Gi Tribe and their [somewhat-justified motivations](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiVillain) for attacking Cosmo Canyon, but keeps them a secret until Red XIII has ventured through the Caves of the Gi.
[Named by the Adaptation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedByTheAdaptation): He had no revealed first name in the original game, but *Rebirth* gives him the first name Geisel.
[Power Floats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFloats): Much like in the original game, Bugenhagen moves around by floating on a large orb.

[Suddenly Shouting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuddenlyShouting): When Cloud starts asking questions about the Lifestream, and whether it could possibly be strengthened in some way to counteract what Shinra has done to it, Bugenhagen starts yelling at him for his ignorance. However, a moment later Bugenhagen calms down and acknowledges that Cloud's questions aren't a bad thing and that he, Bugenhagen, has perhaps grown complacent in his elderly age, despite his desire for people to always be looking for the truth. This seems to be part of what makes him reconsider his position on what the party was saying about  (SPOILER) Weapons appearing .
[Bare-Fisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk): He specializes in using his limbs for combat, having been the one who taught Tifa how to fight.
[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): He's very old, but has a jovial personality and seems to get along better with young people. Tifa describes him as being "both boyish and elderly".

[Eccentric Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EccentricMentor): Zangan is shown to be a very lively and odd man who tends to weird out people, even his own pupils. *Trace of Two Pasts* shows that Tifa was often perplexed by him, as he often disappears for months only to come back with some new lesson or instruction. Sometimes she'd be put off or shocked by his lessons, such as when he started to [insult and goad her](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IShallTauntYou) during one of their sparring sessions just to get a reaction out of her, as a lesson for her to control her emotions.
[Heroic Bystander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBystander): During the Nibelheim Incident, he helped get villagers safely away from Sephiroth's rampage rather than try to stop Sephiroth himself.

[Mentor Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorArchetype): He travels all over the world collecting pupils to teach his Zangan-style martial arts, and becoming one to Tifa when he happens to travel to Nibelheim. He boasts of training martial arts to 128 students across the world.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): Visually, he strongly resembles an older Sabin Rene Figaro from *Final Fantasy VI*, specifically in Yoshitaka Amano's concept art for Sabin where he sports the same beard and hairstyle. Zangan's initial concept art for *Remake* even goes as far as to put him in the exact same pose.

[No Sense of Personal Space](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSenseOfPersonalSpace): He has the habit of invading the personal space of people who catch his eyes, even grabbing their limps unprompted to check their musculature. This was the very first thing he did to Tifa in *Trace of Two Pasts* and to Cloud in *Rebirth*.
[Old Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OldMaster): He's old enough to have grey hair, but is still quite capable fighter and spends his life now passing on the skills he developed in life.
[Canon Immigrant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonImmigrant): He first appeared in the *Trace of Two Pasts* novel before being featured in *Rebirth*.
[Dead Hat Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadHatShot): When Sephiroth kills him, the camera shows Zander's hat as it lands next to his corpse, which Sephiroth promptly steps on.

[Deer in the Headlights](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeerInTheHeadlights): *Rebirth* shows that he cornered Sephiroth alongside the neighborhood watch during his attack on the village, but they were all too terrified of him to even attack, and Sephiroth slowly slaughtered them one by one.

[The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader): He's the Mayor of Nibelheim and the one who organizes the village to deal with it's problems. *Trace of Two Pasts* shows that he wasn't actually elected into the office, and his position as leader is an informal one.

[Off with His Head!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffWithHisHead): While subject to a [Gory Discretion Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoryDiscretionShot), we see Sephiroth line Masamune up to his neck before striking the coup de grâce. Given the length of Masamune, there's no way that stroke wouldn't have decapitated him.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): He was one of Sephiroth's victims in the Nibelheim Incident, and only appears in [flashbacks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flashback).

[Too Dumb to Live](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooDumbToLive): Despite seeing Sephiroth singlehandedly razing Nibelheim, Mayor Zander opts to confront him. Unfortunately for the poor Mayor, Sephiroth slaughtered his men with ease and Zander was too scared to even fire a shot at him. He gets killed with little fanfare shortly after.

[Adaptational Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalNiceGirl): In the original game, she wasn't very welcoming towards Cloud and even called him sick when he claimed the house she lived in was once his. Here, she's far more accommodating and patient, even giving the party important information concerning the black-robed men.

[Beautiful Singing Voice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeautifulSingingVoice): She is prone to bursting out into song at random times, but most people don't seem to mind and it is noted as quite beautiful by Tifa.
[Canon Character All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonCharacterAllAlong): She's the middle-aged woman who lived in Cloud's former home during the original game.
[The Caretaker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCaretaker): Aside from being head chef, she also helps look after the black-robed men being treated in Nibelheim.
[Kindhearted Cat Lover](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KindheartedCatLover): Has a profound love for cats and even adopts Tifa's pet Fluffy and her litter of kittens in a side quest.
[No Indoor Voice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoIndoorVoice): Her random bouts of singing can get quite loud at times.

[Died in Your Arms Tonight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedInYourArmsTonight): The [flashbacks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flashback) to her death show Sonon cradling her in his arms as she passes away from her injuries.

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): She sacrificed herself by [Taking the Bullet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingTheBullet) to protect some civilians from one of Scarlet's war machines.
[Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ninja): Just like Yuffie and Sonon, she was one of Wutai's elite ninjas.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She died in the last battle of the Wutai-Shinra war, before the events of the Remake trilogy. But her death still haunts and motivates Sonon, especially [due to Yuffie's similarity to Melphie causing him to see Yuffie as his little sister](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReplacementGoldfish).
[Sibling Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingTeam): She and Sonon trained together under Godo, and worked together as a ninja duo during the Shinra-Wutai war.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation):  (SPOILER) It is not fully clear if "Glenn" is indeed nothing more than just a disguise for Sephiroth, or if the real Glenn Lodbrok is somehow a part of the same [Hive Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiveMind) that allows Sephiroth to control his clones through Jenova's cells, considering that Sephiroth seems to be limited to only taking on Glenn's appearance instead of more prominent figures who can better move his plans along.

["Ass" in Ambassador](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AssInAmbassador): Despite being sent to meet with Rufus as an emissary of Wutai's interim government, he spends much of the meeting mocking and being rude to Shinra's new president, which turns out to be justified when he admits that he wants the war between the company and Wutai to be resumed,  (SPOILER)  as this is Sephiroth's plan .

[Barefoot Loon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarefootLoon): He's always barefoot, which just adds to his overall extremely off-putting presence. It is also a clear hint to his nature,  (SPOILER) as every other Black Robes are also barefoot.

[Dead All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadAllAlong): Rufus distinctly remembers shooting Glenn in the back at some point prior to the events of the game, and Glenn affirms that Rufus killed him at that point.  (SPOILER) The end of *Rebirth* reveals that "Glenn" is actually Sephiroth assuming his appearance, and when Rufus kills him he's revealed to be a glamoured Black Robe.

[Defector from Decadence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefectorFromDecadence): It's revealed that after the events of "The First Soldier" he and his allies defected from SOLDIER and led a coup d'état against the Wutai government after they surrendered to Shinra.

[Empowered Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmpoweredBadassNormal): He was an elite member of SOLDIER's P0 class—meaning he didn't have any Mako or Jenova cell augmentations—during the Wutai War, but in the present  (SPOILER) is shown to have been infused with Sephiroth's power .

[Fallen Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FallenHero): He was the protagonist of *[Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIIEverCrisis)* ' s "The First Soldier" and a [Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal) member of SOLDIER, but  (SPOILER) is actually Sephiroth taking on the deceased Glenn Lodbrok's appearance .

[Flaw Exploitation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlawExploitation): He exploits the Wutai population's desire for revenge against Shinra to overthrow the country's leaders who have agreed to a ceasefire and trigger a new war against Shinra.

[Manipulative Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManipulativeBastard): Glenn used the Wutaians' righteous indignation at their leaders for agreeing to a ceasefire with Shinra to end the war for him to stage a coup d'état, under the premise of obtaining justice and reparation for all the harm they suffered from the company during the war. However,  (SPOILER) he is not concerned about the well-being of Wutai and its population, but rather intends to cause desolation, anger and unrest in the hopes that this misery will spur the world to unite behind a common cause. This version of him is also actually Sephiroth assuming his appearance because the real Glenn was murdered by Rufus Shinra some time before the story began .

[Smug Snake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmugSnake): Every time they meet, Glenn treats Rufus in a condescending and mocking manner. What ends up being revealed to be on purpose, as Glenn is  (SPOILER) actually Sephiroth in disguise , is deliberately trying to provoke Rufus into continuing his father's plans to resume the war against Wutai.

[Villain with Good Publicity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainWithGoodPublicity): According to Yuffie, Glenn is a popular military leader in Wutai who carried out a successful coup d'état in her country due to the population's discontent with the ceasefire that her father, Godo Kisaragi, made with Shinra, arresting the previous leaders and establishing an interim government until the company is finally defeated.  (SPOILER) Behind the scenes, he admits that he wants the war not for the sake of Wutai, but rather to foment great unrest and desolation that he hopes will unite the people behind the singular purpose of rejuvenating the world, in addition to actually being Sephiroth assuming the deceased Glenn's appearance and manifesting via a black-robed clone.

[Uriah Gambit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UriahGambit): As a pretext for war, Glenn sent a squad of ninja to the Nibel Reactor, where they were gunned down by Shinra security forces. Afterwards, he issued a public broadcast citing this as one of the acts of war committed by Rufus and Shinra.
[War Hawk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarHawk): He advocates the war between Shinra and Wutai resuming as a means of replenishing the Lifestream.
[The Ghost](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGhost): he is mentioned multiple times but has yet to be seen.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): During [The Stinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStinger) of *Rebirth*,  (SPOILER) Rufus's last conversation with Glenn makes it clear that Sarruf is actually Rufus acting under an alias. "Sarruf" is, of course, a phonic anagram of "Rufus" .

[Affectionate Parody](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffectionateParody): Their quirky personalities and obsession over what is basically children's card game is clearly meant to emulate opponents found in a [Card Battle Game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CardBattleGame) series.

[Chuunibyou](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Chuunibyou): Something of a [Running Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunningGag) is just how over-the-top players of Queen's Blood can be. Many of the players wouldn't be out of place in a series like [Yu-Gi-Oh!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/YuGiOh). Hilariously, the players' hammy attitudes towards the game somehow manage to rub off on Cloud and his friends when they play.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): Almost all of them have some sort of humorous gimmick to distinguish themselves.

[Incoming Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncomingHam): Let's just say that the players of Queen's Blood are some of the most colorful people that Cloud will come across. Often it is hard to tell if they are just simply roleplaying or are really that eccentric.

[Serial Escalation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SerialEscalation): The players just keep on getting weirder and weirder as Cloud travels across the Planet, eventually facing unusually smart animals, a Sephiroth Clone, and the undead.

[Serious Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeriousBusiness): Part of their humor among the Queen's Blood players is that they tend to take the card game way too seriously. For example, one player in the Crow's Nest legitimately wants to use the game as a way to negotiation peace with [Shinra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MegaCorp). Although, a couple players are justified for their behavior since  (SPOILER) they are aware there is an actual dangerous curse placed on the card game that has resulted in several people dying, including the creator of Queen's Blood, Lidrehl Balmon .
[Spirited Competitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpiritedCompetitor): Unsurprisingly, they tend to be overly competitive when it comes to their favorite card game.
[To Be a Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToBeAMaster): Nearly all of them aspire to be the world's greatest champion in Queen's Blood.
[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): In regards to Queen's Blood, as she is the undefeated champion. That is until Cloud came along.
[Defrosting Ice Queen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceQueen): She is pretty arrogant when Cloud first meets her on the *Shinra-8*, but does lighten up over time during their next encounters.

[Demonic Possession](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonicPossession):  (SPOILER) She becomes possessed by the Shadowblood Queen at the end of the Queen's Blood sidequest. Cloud and Vincent were able to save Regina after defeating the ghostly queen.

[Department of Redundancy Department](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DepartmentOfRedundancyDepartment): Her first name "Regina" is Latin for queen, while her last name 'Konigin' is German for queen. So her full name could be translated as "Queen Queen." Doubles as a [Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName).

[Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex): Despite her prideful attitude, Regina is actually a very insecure woman who believes she has to keep on winning Queen's Blood otherwise she will end up becoming "nobody." It is due to her insecurities that Regina  (SPOILER) seeked out and took possession of the haunted Shadowblood Queen card in the first place .

[King of Games](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingOfGames): Or "Queen of Cards" in her case. Regina is the renowned champion of the most popular [Card Battle Game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CardBattleGame) on the Planet. The only person who has been about to defeat her in Queen's Blood is Cloud.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Both her first and surname means "queen," which is fitting for the champion of Queen's Blood.  (SPOILER) And also fitting for someone who is two queens from different places in one body .

[Mirror Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MirrorCharacter): To Cloud. Despite their obvious differences, they actually have a lot in common. Both are extremely skilled and aloof individuals, but suffers from having an [Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex). As their respective journeys goes on, both [slowly become friendlier over time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceQueen). Additionally, they both are  (SPOILER) haunted by a sinister force that wants to take control of their bodies through [Demonic Possession](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonicPossession) .

[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): The "Queen of Cards" which is a reference to the [Final Fantasy VIII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIII) character The Queen of Cards and a not so subtly reference to the ["King of Games."](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/YuGiOh),
[The Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRival): To Cloud, but only in regards to Queen's Blood being the current champion and his most frequent opponent in the card game.
[Supernatural Gold Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupernaturalGoldEyes): Has golden irises and is the holder of  (SPOILER) the supernatural Shadowblood Queen card .
[Disappears into Light](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearsIntoLight): If Cloud defeats him in a game of Queen's Blood, Lidrehl's ghost disappears into wisps of Lifestream.

[Ghostly Goals](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GhostlyGoals): Unable to stop  (SPOILER) the Shadowblood Queen's  machinations in-life, Lidrehl's ghost bides his time and searches for a worthy challenger,  (SPOILER) entrusting the Emerald Witch's card with Vincent Valentine to keep it safe. He selects Cloud to be his champion at the Kalm Inn and sends visions to him warning him of what is to come, eventually challenging him to a Queen's Blood match in the Gold Saucer's haunted inn in order to test his mettel .
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): He's been dead for years, having starved to death playing Queen's Blood for days on end.
[Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage): Lidrehl becomes more manic and frantic  (SPOILER) as the Shadowblood Queen's hold over him grows .

[Virtuous Character Copy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VirtuousCharacterCopy): He seems to loosely be based off of [Maximillion Pegasus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/YuGiOh), another creator of a popular card game who based their creation off historical legends and in doing so  (SPOILER) re-introduced dangerous ancient magic into the modern world . Additionally, the protagonists of their stories need to  (SPOILER) defeat the creators at their own card game . But while Pegasus was initially an antagonist in his series, Lidrehl was a good man all along who spent his final days trying to undo his mistake.
[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): He's built up as being the best Queen's Blood player in the Junon region, and is a previous Queen's Blood champion.

[Knight of Cerebus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightOfCerebus): Up until him, Queen's Blood is just a silly minigame, but defeating him for the first time is what first triggers the first vision of Lidrehl Balmon and starts the "serious" plotline involving Queen's Blood. [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope) due to the the [absurb nature of the Queen's Blood plot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeriousBusiness) makes the whole thing still seem humorous.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): He's the first person to tell you about Lidrehl Balmon, and how he disappeared soon after creating Queen's Blood.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Cameron and isn't given a surname.

[Unsportsmanlike Gloating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnsportsmanlikeGloating): If he defeats Cloud, he'll act very smug about it
QUOTE **Cameron:** Don't take it too hard, I'm just that much better than you.
[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent): He claims to have been traveling all over the world in search of playing against a worthy Queen's Blood player.
[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): Chadley claims he's the ace player of the Corel region, and he won't even accept a challenge from Cloud until he's of high enough rank.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): He's a Queen's Blood player who is themed after Buddhist / Hinduist monks.

[Levitating Lotus Position](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LevitatingLotusPosition): He's found in a lotus position while levitating from the ground, something he's able to do due to the powers he gained from his years of meditation.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): He's apparently known as "Navalan of the Thousand Eyes".
[Nothing but Skin and Bones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NothingButSkinAndBones): He has a very skinny body, with his ribs being clearly visible, which ads to his "monk" gimmick.
[Supernatural Gold Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupernaturalGoldEyes): He has golden eyes, which is a sign of his supposed mystical powers.
[Third Eye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirdEye): He claims to have a spiritual third eye, which grants him clarity of the world around him, which is why he can sense the "evil" in Queen's Blood.
[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): He's always shirtless, showing his scrawny, monk physique.

[High Hopes, Zero Talent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighHopesZeroTalent): Putting aside how one could conquer the world through Queen's Blood, Wize isn't even good at the game to begin with considering it's on a losing streak.

[His Name Is...](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HisNameIs): When Wize tries to provide more information on the whereabouts of  (SPOILER) the Shadowblood Queen card , the robot suddenly short circuits and forgot all about the information it gathered on Lindrelh. It is implied that the  (SPOILER) Shadowblood Queen caused Wize to have the unexpected shutdown .
[Missing Steps Plan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingStepsPlan): 1) Become the best Queen's Blood player in the world. 2) ???? 3) World domination.

[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): After receiving the Lindrelh vision, Wize will do a search on the creator of Queen's Blood and will reveal to Cloud how exactly Lindrelh died and the existence of  (SPOILER) the Shadowblood Queen card .
[Take Over the World](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeOverTheWorld): Its ultimate goal, not that it'll achieve it any time soon.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): Initially, Wize is an easy player to beat during Queen's Blood tournament on *Shinra-8*. Apparently, the robot went through several upgrades when encounter again Dustbowl, becoming a much more challenging opponent at the card game.

[Cathartic Crying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatharticCrying): After Cloud beats and he's done crying, he says he feels a lot less stressed now that he's done bawling his eyes out. He even advises Cloud to do try to do the same.
[Embarrassing Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmbarrassingNickname): People in Kalm call him Crybaby Ned because of him being [Prone to Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProneToTears).

[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): His entire character is based on him being [Prone to Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProneToTears) and supposedly getting better at Queen's Blood when he's crying.
[Inelegant Blubbering](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InelegantBlubbering): He stutters a lot while talking due to being either on the verge of tears or actually sobbing.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Ned and isn't given a surname.
[Prone to Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProneToTears): He's called "Crybaby Ned" because of how easily he cries.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): Her gimmick is using [Ventriloquism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ventriloquism) to communicate with cloud via Mr. Cuddlesworth.
[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): Upon losing she will bow politely while thanking Cloud for playing with her.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Nene and isn't given a surname.

[Shrinking Violet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShrinkingViolet): [Implied](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpliedTrope). Nene has a shy voice and mannerisms and it's implied she's using her [Ventriloquism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ventriloquism) skills to better communicate via the more confident Mr. Cuddlesworth persona.
[Ventriloquism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ventriloquism): Uses ventriloquism to talk via her doll Mr. Cuddlesworth, who sounds much more aggressive and confident than her normal voice.

[Cloudcuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Cloudcuckoolander): Most Queen's Blood players are quirky and dramatic, but she brings it to a new level. When Cloud finds her, she has surrounded herself with cardboard boxes to her "barricade" and will be upset when you unavoidably kick them off to talk to her.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): She's obsessed and proud of Kalm's curtain wall and most of her dialogue involves talking about it.

[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): She speaks in an over-the-top and dead [serious manner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeriousBusiness) when it comes to Queen's Blood and how she views herself as the "wall" of Kalm. It's unclear if she's just weird or roleplaying, but if it's the latter then she never breaks her character.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Zahira and isn't given a surname.

[Stone Wall](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoneWall): [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope). Due to her "castle wall" [gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick) she fancies herself as "wall that yields to no one" because of her defensive skills as a Queen's Blood player, but it doesn't actually translate to her cards or gameplay.

[Busman's Vocabulary](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BusmansVocabulary): He's constantly using fisherman jargon while talking about Queen's Blood, such as saying he "hooked a catch" when Cloud approched him for a game or saying his game "swam away" upon being defeated.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): He's an old angler who speaks in fisherman jargon and metaphors and looks down on "inexperienced younglings".

[Older and Wiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderAndWiser): Invoked and subverted. He thinks due to his age and experience, young people can't match him in Queen's Blood, but he isn't that tough and is humbled upon being defeated by Cloud.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Zogan and isn't given a surname.
[Bare Midriffs Are Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareMidriffsAreFeminine): A female sailor whose outfit bares her midriff to emphasize her femininity.

[Busman's Vocabulary](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BusmansVocabulary): She's a sailor who uses sailor jargon when talking about Queen's Blood, such as saying you "took the wind out of my sails" or that she thought her "ship was unsinkable" upon being defeated.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): She's a hard-ass sailor who speaks in sailor jargon and metaphors.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Isabelle and isn't given a surname.

[Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent): She came to the bar to search for a Queen's Blood player who can challenge her, and complains she's bored because she hasn't met anyone yet. She'll be elated if Cloud beats her, but bored if she wins.
[Always Identical Twins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysIdenticalTwins): They're twin brothers with identical appearances, from haircut to clothing.

[Comically Small Demand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicallySmallDemand): They're looking for "rich newbies" for easy wins in Queen's Blood so that they can demand "prize money" after they win, but the amount they ask as a prize is a comically low 3 gil.
[The Dividual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDividual): Despite each being fought separately, they are identical twins with near-identical personalities and you can only interact with them together.
[Sibling Seniority Squabble](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingSenioritySquabble): Darren is considered the leader of the duo because he's the "older" twin.
[Sibling Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingTeam): They're twin brothers who made a Queen's Blood duo.
[Theme Twin Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeTwinNaming): They're twins who both start with the letter D, which they lampshade by calling themselves the "Double D Duo".
[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): Despite his ego, he'll take his loss well and says that it inspired him, musically.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Neil and isn't given a surname.

[Small Name, Big Ego](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallNameBigEgo): He calls himself a musical genius and a future celebrity who first thinks Cloud is a talent scout trying to hire him, but it's clear he's just a small-fry guitarist with big dreams.
[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): She'll act graceful if Cloud wins or loses against her, as all she wants is for more people to start playing Queen's Blood.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Michaela and isn't given a surname.

[Wide-Eyed Idealist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WideEyedIdealist): She's a political activist who wants to use Queen's Blood as a diplomacy tool against Shinra to "bridge the gap" between them, which is a very naive idea, and she herself admits people laugh at her all the time.
[Comically Small Demand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicallySmallDemand): He's trying to shake beat down by beating them in Queen's Blood and demanding money, but the amount is a pitful 7 gil.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): He's a bandit who's bad at being a bandit, so he's trying to be a Queen's Blood player instead.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Biff and isn't given a surname.

[Miles Gloriosus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilesGloriosus): Claims to have been a "legendary" bandit who was "too badass" for Beck's Badasses and got kicked out. After being beaten, he admits it's all a lie and that he just couldn't hack it as a bandit.
[Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeNaming): Claims to have been a member of Beck's Badasses, and he does have the **B** name motif to back it up.

[Animal Athlete Loophole](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalAthleteLoophole): Rolf is a dog who's able to play Queen's Blood, something that is unusual but technically allowed. Rocco claims Rolf got famous enough that he's scheduled to make his television debut on a show that's doing a special on animals who can play queen's blood.
[Canine Companion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanineCompanion): Rolf is Rocco's pet dog, and the two want to become famous together so they can one day leave North Corel.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): Rolf is a dog who can somehow play Queen's Blood.
[The Nose Knows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNoseKnows): Rolf can apparently tell appart Queen's Blood players by their *smell*.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): Rocco isn't given a surname.
[Sore Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoreLoser): He whines upon being defeated and Rocco teases him about being a sore loser.
[Translator Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TranslatorBuddy): Rocco is Rolf's owner, and mostly exists to "translate" what Rolf wants to Cloud.

[Bare Midriffs Are Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareMidriffsAreFeminine): Her shirt exposes her midriff, which adds to her [Hard-Drinking Party Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardDrinkingPartyGirl) image.

[Hard-Drinking Party Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardDrinkingPartyGirl): She's a cheery woman who enjoys partying and goofing off while hitting the bottle, and her table is notably filled with bottles. But upon being defeated, she admits she's cutting back on the booze and the bottles around are just a veggie smoothie.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): Her entire character revolves around her being a hard drinker.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She's only known as Mary and isn't given a surname.

[Pink Elephants](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinkElephants): She says she cut back on the booze once she passed out drunk in the middle of a Queen's Blood match and has an awful nightmare with a "creepy stranger", which is [implied to have been a vision of Lidrehl Balmon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing).
[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): "You'll regret making me come to life".

[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): His gimmick is being a living statue [Street Performer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StreetPerformer), who can somehow stand still while playing Queen's Blood.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Pietro and isn't given a surname.
[Street Performer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StreetPerformer): He's clad in gold paint and clothes so he can perform being a living statue in the middle of the streets of Corel Prison.

[Training from Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrainingFromHell): He's being a living statue [Street Performer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StreetPerformer) in Corel Prison of all places so he can better train his artistic skills in the "harshest of environments". He takes Cloud challenging him to a card game as just another challenge to his craft.
[Delinquent Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DelinquentHair): Has a spiked mohawk hairstyle, which adds to his thug-like appearance.

[Face of a Thug](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceOfAThug): He looks and dresses like a thug to intimidate people into not messing with him in Corel Prison, but that also scares off normal people and he has a hard time finding anyone who wants to play Queen's Blood with him. After being beaten by Cloud he's convinced to try to act more friendlier so people will want to talk to him.
[Gas Mask Mooks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GasMaskMooks): He's a Corel thug who wears a gas mask, which is a big reason why he's so intimidating to normal people.

[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): His character revolves around him acting like a thug to fit in Corel Prison, but that makes it difficult to find anyone willing to play Queen's Blood.
[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): He doesn't mind losing, being just happy he has finally found someone to play against.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Dax and isn't given a surname.

[*Crack!* "Oh, My Back!"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrackOhMyBack): The reason he's sitting down and willing to play Queen's Blood is because he has hurt his back while working the farm, due to his old age.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): His character revolves around being an old farmer who plays Queen's Blood.
[Graceful Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLoser): He's a very good sport after getting beaten, joking Cloud was "running circles around me like one of those professional racing Chocobos".

[Friend to All Living Things](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendToAllLivingThings): His farm animals are so fond of him that they follow and hang around him even when he's taking a break from work, which is why he's surrounded by them.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): He's only known as Pietro and isn't given a surname.

[Animal Athlete Loophole](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalAthleteLoophole): Just like Rolf, Oscar is a animal who's capable (and allowed) to play Queen's Blood. Landon even says Oscar is supposed to go on an official televised duel against a dog, which is heavily implied to be Rolf.
[The Gimmick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGimmick): Oscar is a Forest Chocobo who can somehow play Queen's Blood.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): Landon isn't given a surname.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Oscar is known as "Oscar the Swift" by the Gongaga Youth Coalition.
[Sore Loser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoreLoser): Landon says Oscar gets bitter about losing, and he'll angrily grumble if Cloud beats him.

[Translator Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TranslatorBuddy): Landon is assigned to take care of Oscar for the Gongaga Youth Coalition, and mostly exists so he can "translate" what Oscar wants to Cloud.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): Is Dale really the one playing Queen's Blood, or is Sephiroth just messing with Cloud yet again, because there's nothing he won't stoop to if it means spiting Cloud?
[It Can Think](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItCanThink): Assuming Dale is the one playing, it's proof that Sephiroth Clones retain some measure of intelligence.

[Ambiguously Human](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyHuman): Given the time frame she was alive and being a wielder of "arcane magic," it is quite possible she might have been a Cetra, or a human skilled in using materia or some other magic system that has been lost to time.
[The Ghost](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGhost): Literally. Unlike the Shadowblood Queen, the Emerald Witch's spirit is never heard speaking.

[Good Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodCounterpart): Like the Shadowblood Queen, she is a spirit bound to a one-of-a-kind Queen's Blood card. Unlike the Shadowblood Queen, she is wholly benevolent and seeks to stop her nemesis from making a comeback.

[Good Witch Versus Bad Witch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodWitchVersusBadWitch): The Emerald Witch was a benevolent sorceress who led a rebellion against the evil Shadowblood Queen—a tyrannical [Sorcerous Overlord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SorcerousOverlord)—and saw to it that she was executed. However, the Shadowblood Queen's vengeful spirit was [Barred from the Afterlife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarredFromTheAfterlife) and began plotting to make a comeback through the Queen's Blood card made in her likeness, so the Emerald Witch's spirit incarnated as a Queen's Blood card to oppose her once again.
[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): She was a heroic sorceress who fought against an evil queen many centuries before the events of the games.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She's been dead for countless centuries, but hasn't passed on to the Lifestream due to her nemesis also persisting.

[Sealed Good in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedGoodInACan): Her spirit is bound to the Queen's Blood card made in her likeness, and is the only thing able to stop the Shadowblood Queen's rise to power.

[Virtuous Character Copy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VirtuousCharacterCopy): Considering all the *[Yu-Gi-Oh!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/YuGiOh)* shoutouts permeating the side quest, she is one to the Spirit of the Ring. Another spirit bound to a likeminded object to the nemesis they faced long ago, but where the Spirit uses the Pharoah's return to usurp his power, The Emerald Witch waits to stop her nemesis from returning to conquer the world.

[Adaptational Early Appearance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalEarlyAppearance): The Weapons were a very late game twist in the original, rising from the planet as a last resort to save it after  (SPOILER) Cloud gives Sephiroth the Black Materia . They are introduced much earlier with *Rebirth* as a concept. However, the only Weapons we actually see are [Canon Foreigners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonForeigner) who were created for the remakes, with all of the more antagonistic Weapons still in slumber.

[Adaptational Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalNiceGuy): The Weapons seen in the original game were powerful but neutral forces, just as likely to impede the parties progress as help them. These two are explicitly on the party's side, one takes Tifa to see Sephiroth's corruption of the Lifestream,  (SPOILER) and may have given her the power to fight it on her end , so that she can tell the others about his actions. Tifa even ends their encounter wishing it luck. Though these are not the same Weapons as the ones seen in the original game, and may have been awakened with different priorities in mind.
[Canon Foreigner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanonForeigner): The two Weapons seen in *Rebirth* are new to the series and not based on any in the *Compilation*.
[The Dividual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDividual): The two seen Weapons are a pair of whale-like beasts only slightly different in color from each other and work together.
[Guardian Entity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuardianEntity): Red describes them as tutelary creatures called upon to defend the planet.
[Light Is Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood): Within the chest of the Weapons is a massive Materia that glows with a cleansing light that destroys the Black Whispers that follow Sephiroth.

[Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron): The Weapons are incredibly resilient, fitting their role as guardians of the Planet.  (SPOILER) When Sephiroth engages one, his sword actually gets stuck in its hide, making him [show a flicker of concern](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoStoic) before he forces the blade through. Even then, the Weapon is able to drive him off and go on its way .

[The Worf Barrage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWorfBarrage): Showing how powerful these creatures are,  (SPOILER) Tifa sees a battle between them and Sephiroth and while it is hurt by his strikes, he does put a significant amount of effort into hurting ones shoulder and has to leave without doing much else .
